Biggest plus: Hotel shares a building with the Westside Brewing Company - great location for beer-lovers... have fun!

title: “worked out just fine for me”
text: i stayed here for three nights last summer. i reserved a room w/private bath, and i think that's the way to go unless you want to feel like you're in a hostel. yes, you should be prepared to carry your own luggage up three or four flights of stairs, and the stairwells are kind of gross, but my room was perfectly clean and the bed was fine. i like the upper west side location-- as a female traveling alone, it's a neighborhood i feel safe in.

title: “Value for money hotel”
text: Stopped in this hotel for 4 nights. It is easy to get to using the tube, and I used public transport to get back to JFK airport from this hotel. The hotel was clean but in need of a bit of decorating. It was looking a bit tired. My room was cleaned every day and the bathrooms were clean. You could borrow a hair dryer from reception. The room I stayed in was very warm but I had no problems with noise. The location was great if you wanted to visit local resturants. There is a large cinema near by too. It was near to central park and the museums. On the Sunday there was craft / antique fair going on in the local school which looked like a regular thing. This is prob. a good hotel for couples or if you want to be away from all the noise of NY traffic. It is near a good tube station so you can easily get to Time Square etc.. Good if you want somewhere cheap to stay which is safe and clean.

title: “Great place, great price”
text:
This was my 2nd stay at this hotel.
When I first stayed, in Feb 2005, I was on the 1st floor, facing Amsterdam Av, and had to leave the window open because the heating had no controls. This was quite noisy.
This time, we were on the 3rd floor facing the rear of the building, the heating seemed lower, and the noise was not a problem.
I can also understand why someone with 3 heavy bags might not like this hotel.
However, we loved it. The staff was so helpful, finding info for us, lending us a hairdryer, etc.
A great hotel in a convenient location for a great price.

title: “Great Location!!”
text:
My daughter and I stayed here for four nights and found it to be a very clean and well kept hotel, they are doing some renovations now which should give it a nicer look.
We had room 204 with a private bath which we would recommend, it was on the second floor and was very clean.
It was a great location and was just five minutes from the subway.
Our only drawback was the steep stairs as you enter the building which make getting large suitcases up a challenge, so try and get the first floor or second.

title: “A good budget-conscious choice”
text:
We stayed in NYC in mid December and found the Amsterdam Inn very pleasant for the price. We stayed in a room w/ a private bath (No. 103) and it was quite nice; the furnishings were new and attractive and the bathroom was particularly clean, roomy and stylish. We also found the staff very friendly and helpful. Some minor problems are that the heating pipes are a bit noisy and there's no way to regulate the temperature in the rooms (it got quite hot and dry).
Overall, I believe it is a very good bargain.

title: “great budget place to stay”
text:
After reading the previous reviews about the hotel I was not feeling very positive about the hotel before we arrived. After staying there I would recommend the hotel as a decent,cheap place to stay in a very good location.
Based on 76th street the hotel is only a five min walk to the subway at 72nd street and so travelling around Manhattan is not a problem. 
When we arrived the check in was smooth and the man on the desk helpful. We were given a room on the top floor and to be honest it wasn't too big a deal as we are young-ish spring chickens but older guests may find the stairs tiring.
On first impressions the room was small but it was just big enough to store our 2 largish bags and all our chrismas shopping for five days.
The double bed was comfy(and I am fussy when it comes to beds) and we slept well each night-although we were exhausted every night after our travels.
We didn't experience any noise worse than to be expected when staying in New York-our room was at the back though.
There was no wardrobe but instead a rail with about 6 hangers and a chest of drawers and bedside table to store belongings.
We also had a sink in the room which was good seeing as we were sharing a bathroom.
The bathroom we used was fine,it was clean and modern and after mastering how to get the right temp with the shower, using the bathroom was not a problem. There was always hot water and we never had to wait to use the shower,there was also a bath on one of the lower floors.
The maid service was good and we always came back to a clean room with fresh towels.
Girls be warned though, that we didn't have a hairdryer in our room but we borrowed one from reception when we needed it. Also the room tended to get very hot from the radiator so we did tend to sleep with the window open, but we felt quite safe.
Two places to visit food wise are Crumbs,just across the road, a little bakery serving the most gorgeous cakes and desserts and The utopia restaurant where we often found ourselves having breakfast (across the street from the 72nd st subway- get the choc chip pancakes).
So overall I would recommend the hotel and I say this in the knowledge that I have travelled extensively all over the world staying in hostels to 5 star hotels- just expect what you are paying for-if you want a five star room then you need to pay for it,if you are looking for a clean,no frills room in a good location then that is what you will get-remember you get what you pay for!!

title: “Not bad if you're looking for a cheap stay!”
text: My friend and I stayed at the Amsterdam Inn for two weeks in June. On first impressions, the atmosphere was quite cold and un-welcoming from the deskperson and we were horrified to find that we had to carry our extremely large bags up three flights of steep stairs! The room was very basic, but suited us as we were out and about in New York every day. The noise at night was pretty bad, as it is situated above a car park as well as being on a busy road. I suggest tiring yourself out all day, as so you will sleep through it! Maid service was excellent, they worked very hard and were very friendly, however the towels that are replaced daily would sometimes have black stains on them! All in all it was a cheap but suitable place to stay-if you're really desperate to see New York, as we were. Not the most friendly of staff or the nicest of rooms, but it wasn't a bad place to stay. Our time in New York wasn't about the hotel!

title: “If you have a bad back dont stay here ?”
text:
Where do I start ?
After flying in from Las Vegas I thought I knew what to expect.
With 3 heavy bags the last thing I needed to hear that we were on the third floor.No ELEVATOR.When we got to the room the room was tiny Nearly 1/2 Newyork Average.Still the Room was comfortable.
Having read the reviews regarding noise I thought they were exagerated UNTIL at regulr intervals the Fire Engine on the next block ( small block) would go off or the cars would screech in or out of the car park below our window.
There was no escape from the noise.
One shared bathroom on our floor would challenge even the best cotusionist from any Circus small is an overstatement.
If you want a placecheap to get you off the streets then this is ok otherwise look elsewhere.
on the plus side this place is extremely cheap for a New York weekend $90 compared to $220 in other hotels of 3*.The bed is somewhat comfortable.
Location is excellent with the metro line close bye.
 Any advise pack light.......ok for short break but on the back end of a holiday with large heavy bags.....give it a miss.

title: “Good deal for the money”
text: I recently came to New York for a few nights. I was looking for an inexpensive, barebones place to get some sleep, since my entire time was filled to the max. I found out about this place and was actually pleased: for the money, it was a very sensible hotel in a great location in New York. If you're looking for a resort this is not for you, but if you're on the go and need an inexpensive yet decent place to sleep at night, I recomment it.

title: “This is a horrible place!!!!”
text: This Inn is a horrible deal for the service you get. We arrived at the Amsterdam Inn prepared that it was not going to be a posh experience. What we got was much worse that we imagined. We were greated by an unfriendly desk person and then directed (be prepared to carry your own baggage up at least two flights of steep steps please)to a tiny, dark room with two very small twin beds, both felt like you were laying on a board. One was sitting at such an angle that when you went to lay on it, you rolled off...really! The towels were an odd grayish white, bordering on brown and the "view" was a brick wall, two feet from our window. To top it all off, our heater vented hot steam into the room, creating a sauna like experience...now, I'm quite certain that was not in the brochure. The desk person informed us he could not fix the heater problem until the next day and that he had no other rooms because our room was now "used" and he did not offer us any discount for the inconvience. We left the Amsterdam Inn that night, never to return again. My advice, pay a little more and find something else, this is not worth it for the nightmare experience.

title: “Good enough for us!”
text:
We stayed at the Amsterdam Inn in the end of September for 8 nights. We had requested for a twin room with private facilities. 
Everything went well with the checking-in process. Our room was right next to the reception area on the first floor. At first when we entered the room it seemed very noisy. The sounds of traffic from Amsterdam Avenue could be heard very clearly, like if a window was open. We asked for another room, but they didn't have one. Good thing we brought earplugs with us! But then after we had spent an entire day in the downtown area and came back to our hotel, it seemed very quiet. And we were always so tired when we came back, that we had no problems falling asleep.
The room itself was very nice and small, but it was big enough for us and our luggage. The bathroom was great, everything looked very new. The maid-service came by every day and brought clean towels. The staff was very nice too and helpful. Helped us with our transportation to the JFK etc. So thank you for you all!
The neighbourhood was great! Lots of nice looking restaurants around and a subway station was only few blocks away. There's a nice pub in the same building where the hotel is too. You get a breakfast voucher from the hotel that entitles you to a bagel and coffee or juice in a nearby bakery/shop, which was very convenient and the bagels were always very fresh if not straight out of the oven. 
So all in all, we enjoyed our stay in the Amsterdam Inn. It's good, if you don't plan on staying in the hotel room all day, but are there only to sleep. And the location is superb!

title: “Clean, Cute and Convenient”
text:
I was travelling on my own and stayed in a small room on the third floor. The room was plain, but extremely clean and turned over daily with all towels etc replaced as required. There was even a reasonable television with cable for catching up on the news.
The staff were professional and happily arranged for my large suitcase to be carried up and down the stairs on arrival and checkout. This hotel is in an amazing location. A couple of blocks from Central Park and the Museum of Natural History, an easy walk to Broadway, and right on two main metro lines that run the length of Manhattan.
I would prefer to stay here over a mainstream hotel purely for the location.

title: “Great for the price”
text: A friend and I took a quick one-night trip into the city, and we were on a budget, and this place is perfect for that. The staff is extremely nice and helpful, and the location could not be better for anywhere in the Upper West Side. Close to great restaurants and fun bars. While the rooms are kind of a step above a hostel, I did get lucky enough to be upgraded to a room with a private bath, so I was extremely grateful for that. It's great for one night, but probably not an extended visit. No elevator, like everyone here has said, and I did stay on the 4th floor, so lots of stairs...but who doesn't need the exercise? Really glad I found this place. I will stay there again if need be.

title: “Truely a hidden treasure”
text: 1st let me say that the staff is extemely helpful, the beds are super comfortable an rooms are immaculate. I stayed on the 1st level so my room had a lil sink ,fridge, and microwave ...just so convenient especially if your on a budget. Heres the thing about this hotel 1. your in manhattan...so yes at most of any of these hotels your going to hear street level noise unless you stay at a high rise hotel where you can be placed on the 10th flr or above . the hotel gives you everything you need and the loction couldnt be better for the price. alot of these reviews are so misleading because travelers would like to pay motel 6 rates expecting a Ritz carlton hotel, I wish people would be more realistic when making travel plans ..in NEW YORK CITY you get what you pay for and in my opinion Amsterdam Inn offers a little more. You really cant beat their service , and location at their rates.

title: “What a pleasure”
text: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at this quaint hotel for one week.Apon arrival we found the hotel to be very clean and the staff to be very pleasant and helpful.My husband and I had a room with a private bath the room was very clean and a nice size. We love this hotel so much that we will be back often, not only beause we enjoyed our stay but beause the location of the hotel is great! right in the heart of broadway, so we were never board and transportaion was very easy as well a lot of buses and trains and cabs so it made it easy to go back and forth. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone look for that new york experience and for more bang for their buck the as the private bath also came with a breakfast voucher and staff went out of their way to make us at home.

title: “Disgusting!”
text: This was the worste hotel that I have ever stayed in! After climbing 17 stairs with heavy luggage and no offer of assistance from staff, the room was small, linens old and worn, beds were inproperly made no mattress pads, the noise from the bar below and the street was unbearable. The shower did not work, there were no towels and no extra pillows, or any other nicety that you would expect in any hotel. We were told that we would be given a coupon for a "free" bagel down the street which we never received, as it turned out, the bagel place turned out to be a dump too! Do not waste your money on this dump!!!

title: “DON'T STAY HERE!!! It's AWFUL!!!”
text: Bathroom was dirty. Room was freezing. HORRIBLE street noise. NO ELEVATOR! NO mattress pads on the beds and they looked at me like I was crazy when I asked for one. Sheets were thread-bare and had holes. And NO HEAT in the bathroom at all!! I am sorry I believed the semi-acceptable reviews for this place to save some money. Stayed 1 out of 3 nights and booked a 4-star hotel on Priceline for almost the same price.

title: “Downtown European Experience”
text:
We accepted, but didn't need, the free l Day Gym passes being distributed outside the entrance on Amsterdam Street. This is because we received the Switzerland-type hike up an immediate flight when you enter. (Personally, I liked being off the street level. However, it took 2 flights to escape the street noise on the weekend.) We expected some of this from an uptown/downtown boutique hotel. 
We found the service to be excellent when we requested a higher floor room to escape the street noise of our 1st night. Our room DID NOT have an in-room refrigerator, but the desk manager kindly offered to share the staff refrigerator for a few small items. 
The rooms were very clean and bathrooms manicured. Continental Breakfast passes came with the room key at a location down the block. Best of all, it was only 1-2 blocks to the nearest subway stop to go anywhere in town. I would definitely stay again.

title: “Value for money”
text: The cheapest hotel I could afford in NY and was excellent value for money. The hotel had a slight hostel feel but is great for young people looking for somewhere decent to stay, The room was basic but you get what you pay for

title: “no frils, with an intersting location”
text:
Good place 2 stay where u can see real new yorkers going about their day. Go to Zabars for a bagel at breakfast, walk thru the park, get a pizza at Nick's, all stuff New yorkers do, and from this hotel u can do it all.
Now, onto the hotel. The rooms r really small. u have a bed, a tv at the en of the bed, and a bathroom, and thats it. u definatley would never pay this much for a hotel anywhere in the world but in New york (and maybe London).
In the future i probably wouldnt stay here again. Altho we were on the 1st floor, it was still a real pain to carry ur bags up just one flight of stairs.
The staff were generally quite good. a little bit quiet and that, but they did ensure security was tight all the time

title: “Only in Manhattan one puts up with this”
text:
Yes, they are friendly and common areas are very clean. The rooms are the problem.
Mine didn't have a bedside lamp so you had to keep the ceiling lights on if you wanted to read, go to the bathroom at night or just take a peek at your watch inthe middle of the night. I asked for one and they said they didn't have an extra one.
I also asked for a chair as there was no place to place the laptop (they do suggest a service at a cost) but you can only place the laptop in your bed.
All this for a room with shared bath at 117.00 dollars including tax. No breakfast of course. No elevator. So at least 5 flights of stairs. 
The bedspread looked so ancient that one has to remove it immediately. Now, noise.
The staff yells from one floor to the other and from one end of the corridor to the other and feels like they are inside your room. 
There is a huge construction site next door, deluxe condominiums and since the windows and window airconditioners are not in the best of shape (the accordion closures tattered) you can hear the construction noise all day.
This hotel should be billed as a notch above a youth hostel and should cost 60.00 a night MAX. Not a cent more for what you get.
Next time in Manhattan I will book earlier, pay more and save on other things so as to not have to give business to establishments like this.
I would recommend everyone to find better value elsewhere.

title: “Good clean budget room”
text:
I had never stayed in a budget hotel before
But I got a good cheap clean hotel
Even though the bathroom was shared it was always clean 
The room was a single that was small but at about £35 per night it was ok and for that price you could get alot worse in NYC than the Amsterdam Inn
The staff were pleasant 
The facilitys are not of a hotel but then you are not paying usual hotel rates 
The location was good ideal for walking and good local bars and restaurants
Ideal for someone who is travelling alone just sleeping in the room and seeing the sights during the day and socialising at night 
I would stay again

title: “Dirty!”
text: My boyfriend and i were stuck in nyc at 2 am and were desperate to find a place to sleep. We saw this hotel and called and the guy said he had rooms available. When we arrived we got a room for 69 plus tax so it came out to 80, pretty cheap for nyc... WRONG. The room was cheap but the quality was horrible. First we got stuck on the 4th floor so we had to carry our heavy suitcases all the way up. When we walked into the room it was small. just enough for the bed and our luggage on the floor (which we tripped over) exhausted we got ready for bed and when we pulled back the sheets the pillows had black stains on them and then comforter had pubes on it. The room was filthy. spots all over the wall, carpet comming up. NOT WORTH THE MONEY! i've stayed in hostiles for half the price nicer than this hotel. bottom line, the place is dirty dont stay here unless you like living in other peoples filth.

title: “Budget Conscious”
text: I got exactly what I was expecting: a pleasant little no-frills hotel for the budget conscious.It was clean, quiet. daily maid service, secured front door and conveniently located. The only drawback was that I was situated on the fourth floor and there is no elevator service.I was assigned a "shared bathroom" room and found it less inconvenient then I'd anticipated. Each floor has many.

title: “No complaints for the price”
text: Upon first arriving at the Amsterdam Inn, I saw the long maroon canopy with the name printed alongside it. The long narrow canopy led to a single door. Upon looking at that single door and the narrow staircase through the window in the door, I thought, "Oh, Lord, what kind of hotel did I book myself into?" I had a buzz the front desk to be let in and walk up a narrow flight of stairs to get to the there. There are security cameras so they can watch who they let in. I didn't have any problems checking in and I even got the room I had requested. It's the kind of hotel where you have to leave the room key at the front desk everytime you leave the hotel to go out. It didn't bother me because that meant I didn't have to keep up the key. The staircases were narrow as were the hallways. The room I had booked, though, betrayed what I thought it was going to be like considering my first glance at the small yellow hallways. The room was surprisingly nice and decent for the cost. I booked a room with a private bathroom and it was clean and decent as well. The room was bigger than I expected it to be. All I really wanted was a safe and clean place to sleep and shower after exploring the city. Lots of little eateries are around and Central Park is only 2 blocks away. You could hear noise from the outside but I chalked it up to the charm of NYC. I could hear people out in the hallways coming in after a night on the town but there was no partying and no real trouble. I didn't expect total silence but on the whole the noise wasn't much to complain about. It's not a bad place to stay. Everything looked new in my room. If they can keep the rooms up, I don't think this would be a bad place to stay even a year from now. I would consider staying there again. I gave it a four because it was worth the price and the room exceeded the expectations I had.

title: “Do not stay here.”
text: When we arrived they could not find our reservation. They gave us two very small rooms instead of one tripple room as we had reserved. The second day we were moved to a tripple room. It was dirty, noisy and the beds were very uncomfortable. It is very expensive for the service they give. I do not recomend to stay at this hotel.

title: “Solid Midtown Lodging”
text: I've stayed several times at this hotel and it's become my favorite in the midtown are. Two blocks from Grand Central, it has easy subway access, it's close to the dropoff point for airport shuttles, it has an efficient check-in desk and most of all the rooms are comfortable. I've had rooms in several configurations and all have been perfectly acceptable in size and, thankfully for Manhattan, rooms are quiet. The beds are very comfortable, the A/C is powerful and easy to control and the bathrooms are well appointed (good toiletries and towels large and fluffy enough for tall adults). It's clean, well maintained and the front desk is quick to respond to issues (a broken hair dryer was replaced in ten minutes). For both business and leisure travel, this is one of my go-to stops in Manhattan. The in-house restaurant is adequate - service is good but the menu is limited and pricey (but then again, that's the norm in Manhattan). There are two computers next to the restaurant in lieu of a more formal "business center." There is no coffee shop in the hotel, but several within a block's walk. Door service is excellent - the guys at the front can get a cab even at the busiest times. Checkout can be a bit lengthy on busy mornings because the front desk only has three cashiers even at peak ."periods, but this drawback aside, I give it two thumbs up.

title: “Excellent hotel”
text: This was my 2nd trip to New York and I could not fault this hotel. Yes ok food and drinks are expensive, but arent they all in hotels!! There is a Pax restaurant next door which is more than adequate for breakfast. Staff are lovely and could not fault them. Very close to Grand Central Station and Times Square is only a few blocks away. Had a fantastic time. Room was on the 25th floor and did not hear any noise.

title: “Helmsley before become the Westin. What has changed?”
text:
Stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights before the new year.
Of the benefits:
good location, great views of the city, quite spacious rooms, SPA-cosmetics in the bathroom.
The rest - big and noisy and needed renovation.
Hopefully after renaming in to the Westin it become better.
December 2011/

title: “Great hotel and brilliant location!”
text: We had a great stay in the Westin recently, the hotel is lovely and very near grand central and times square etc. The rooms were lovely, service was great and staff very friendly. Our room even had a view of the empire state! Would definitely stay again and recommend for business, groups, family etc!

title: “Average westin”
text: The rooms are nice and relatively large for New York. LCL was an above average hotel bar; it seems fun and somewhere locals actually visit. The only problem with the hotel was a rather average check in. We were already upgraded to a corner room, but none were available. So why bother telling us? We were promised a high floor and a great room. In reality it was a handicapped room with no view. As a gold member, one would expect a little better than that honestly. Its still a great value on SPG points but I wouldnt pay $400 a night.

title: “Beautiful, Comfortable and Central Stay”
text: I recently stayed at the Westin Grand Central New York between Nov 29th - Dec 2nd on my first trip to NYC. This hotel is two blocks away from Grand Central Station and super close to the Chrysler building. It's located on 42nd Street and 3rd Ave and I was very happy with the location. It's nearby lots of affordable restaurants on 3rd Ave, Bryant Park is 4 blocks west on 42nd and the United Nations is 2 blocks east on 42nd. So I would consider this hotel pretty centrally located. The hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas and the staff were very friendly and accomodating. Our room was very big, clean and comfortable, they have the heavenly bed which was very cozy and hard to get out of in the morning. This hotel had recently been renovated and the room had everything that we would need. I was also happy because the hotel was able to give us some great coupons for shopping in the city which was great! I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone staying in New York anytime soon.

title: “Good value and was truly what you would expect in a westin”
text: I stayed here in dec, which is about 2 months after it opened. The rate was one of the best around. I had requested adjoining rooms because I had children with me - they were one of the few hotels that could guarantee we would be given these rooms. It was great because the rooms are across the hall from each other and separated have the option to be separated by another locked door so no one could access our rooms at all in the night. Great piece of mind...preserved a pot of coffee in the morning and it was brought up within 5 minutes or so. Overall good property. The location isn't in the heart of time square which may not be the worst thing and is easily accessible to cabs on 2 nd and 3 rd Avenue

title: “Not a Westin standard hotel”
text: The only positive is the great Westin beds. Otherwise the Westin Grand Central is a disappointment. The rooms are reasonably sized as are the bathrooms but the staff let the place down. I stayed a week and was never acknowledged by any of the numerous doormen constantly standing around in the lobby doing goodness knows what. The reception staff are unfriendly and only 1 of them ever smiled in the week. The bar/restaurant was not open after renovations lasting more than 6 months. The concierge staff again never smiled but at least we're helpful. The room servicing was hit and miss- most days something would be forgotten to be replaced. Westin needs to do some serious staff training on service because it makes all the difference to your stay

title: “An average hotel, below the usual Westin standard”
text:
Well, where do I start ?. I had high expectations after staying in a number of Westin’s globally however, I’m afraid I left my stay at the Westin Grant Central NYC a very unhappy and frustrated customer.
Firstly, I had booked here with a group attending a conference in NYC, so all up there were 12 of us staying for periods between 4 and 8 nights, so I figure just based on the room rate we were charged the bill was USD$70,000 plus meals, drinks, dry cleaning etc.. etc.. Not to say I was expecting anything “amazing”, but an adequate service would have been nice.
First impressions are good, an ok location in mid-town, not too far from Grand Central Terminal. The hotel is reasonably modern and well accessible. The check in process was ok, albeit there were only 2 clerks on duty and a 20 minute wait after a long flight was a drag. the check-in staff were not overly friendly or warm, and I really detected an air of indifference in their attitude. Anyway, after what seemed an extensive wait we received our key and made our way to the 14th floor. 
The luggage arrived not long thereafter and we provided the porter the customary tip. Seeing we had just arrived at JFK with no opportunity to exchange currency, we offered an AUD 5 dollar note. The porter seemed miffed at this, scoured and left with barely an acknowledgement…… geez, sorry I didn’t anticipate the inconvenience I was going to cause the porter by not thinking ahead and exchanging some currency !.
As you do after being out of contact for some 24 hours, I logged on to the guest wireless internet. This is expensive at USD$15 + taxes per device per day. As my partner and I had a Blackberry, Iphone, Laptop and Ipad between us, this proved to be an expensive option. There were no discount plans available for 3 day/7 day plans either. This is quite a scam if you ask me as wireless is readily available for free around NYC.
The rooms themselves are functional. The beds are great, as I’ve come to expect with the Westin’s I’ve stayed in. The LCD screen is huge and provides a wide range of free to air and pay options. The bathroom is adequate, but a little on the small side and you could not accommodate 2 persons in there at the same time. A pet hate are the fabric shower screens which I personally find a little unhygienic.
We slept well, and ventured out the next day to do some exploring. Upon arriving back at the room at 4pm, the room hadn’t been attended to. A call to reception fixed this, but hey…. should I have to remind them of this ?. We also noticed that the little things went unnoticed, the tissue box in the bathroom remained empty for days, toilet paper was left to run low etc.
On the second last day we had left a laundry bag with a few basics to be laundered and a tie to be dry-cleaned. They forgot to collect the laundry and we had to remind housekeeping later in the day when we returned to the room. No apology, but they said they would try and return our laundry by 5pm the next day, even though it was a Saturday. Well, the laundry returned, and I don’t want to seem picky but everything was individually hung and plastic wrapped. I personally think this is excessive and the hotel should re-think it’s green credentials. My main beef was that the underwear and 3 blouses plus 1 tie came to USD$120 + taxes. Please…… I would rather an $80 service with less plastic !... ohh, and the tie came back from being dry cleaned with a stain clearly still evident.
The disaster in the hotel which will be this properties undoing is the dining room. Faulty Towers has nothing on this place. Where do I start ?. 
Firstly I will acknowledge that the dining room and bar are recently opened, and as some reviewers have mentioned, the hotel had no dining/bar options for some time, so this must be an improvement…. perhaps… ?
The breakfast offered at the dining room is very basic. It consists of a buffet that comprises the following – 3 types of cereals, 2 types of flavoured yoghurts, fresh fruit (blueberries, strawberries, bananas), hot options (scrambled eggs, crispy bacon, sausages, roast potatoes), Muffins, breakfast bread rolls. The food didn’t look particularly appetising and at USD $25 each + taxes and service, it was poor value for money.
They make it very clear that this is a buffet and that they don’t do a-la-carte, but if you ask, they will “sometimes” accommodate your requests. The weird part is that that have a chef on attendance at the buffet (all decked out in high peak chef’s hat etc) and his primary role is to stir the eggs in the server. This was weird as when I asked him for some toast, he looked at me with a blank expression and he said that he “didn’t serve”, and motioned me towards a waiter. I still can’t quite figure out what his role was ?.
I think my main complaint with this restaurant was the service. The wait staff were down right rude. For example ; My partner was up at the buffet selecting some food and when the waiter came by to serve some coffee, I also ordered a green tea for my partner. 2 minutes later my partner sat down and decided that rather than green tea, she wanted Calm tea (a mixture of chamomile tea and other leafs). Five minutes later, the green tea arrived and when we enquired about the Calm tea, we were greeted with a scorn, and told that it was too late, as it had already been made !!... lol
On our last day we attended the buffet again and after being seated, we enquired if it was possible to get a side of smoked salmon. We were greeted with scorn at this request by the waiter and reminded of the no a-la-carte rule, but he would do his best. 20 mins later he returned to confirm that the chef would “make some”. When I politely enquired why the chef was required to “make” a side portion of smoked salmon, I was given some flippant comment that “it doesn’t appear on the plate by itself” and that it takes preparation etc. Anyway another 10 minutes elapsed and we were presented with some smoked salmon, bagels, cream cheese, onions and capers……. Now I know why the chef was required to “make it”, but this was quite different to what I had ordered. If only the waiter had explained this, there wouldn’t have been an issue.
At an adjacent table, the waiter was berating a customer for allowing their 5 yo girl to pick at a plate of food when she hadn’t paid for the service …. Seriously, the food is average and over-priced and why would you bother making a big deal of this… and particularly in middle of service, embarrassing the customer and making the other guests feel uncomfortable.
And finally, after breakfast we went back to the room and then went to check out. Upon checking the bill, I noticed that the breakfast hasn’t been included. I advised the clerk of this, and he phoned the dining area to see if he could get the charge posted. After 2 attempts and 5 minutes of waiting on the call for them to answer, I went to the restaurant myself to ask if they could post the charge. The restaurant was empty and I was told that by one of the SEVEN staff that it’s not normal practice to do this until end of shift ??. By this stage they could see I was getting irate and the Supervisor came across and attended to my request for me (how hard is It to request that I be charged !!). I went back to the front desk and he then proceeded to check me out and rolled his eyes muttering something about the poor restaurant……… clearly I wasn’t the only unhappy customer.
Any finally, upon checking out, I was on a 2 pm flt, my partner on a 6pm one, so I asked for a late check-out (no problems there). The only problem was that once they did this, the internet was cancelled and despite renewing the service earlier that day for their daily flat charge, we needed to do it again.
In summary, this is a hotel with lots of potential, but lacking in service ethos. The dining room is a joke and they need to re-visit this from scratch. 
I would not stay here again. There is no way my Co. will be sending $70K here again, there are other hotels in NYC that would like our custom I’m sure.

title: “One Huge Mess”
text:
The rooms at this particular Westin are excellent and roomy (for NYC standards). Other than that, this hotel is a complete wreck. As a longtime SPG member, I've stayed at many of their hotels over the years and can say that without a doubt this is on of their most poorly executed examples. Some of the staff are very friendly and knowledgeable. The rest are just plain clueless and unmotivated to help anyone. 
I went to check in at 5pm on a Saturday, there were about 20 people standing inside the lobby (which isn't very big) waiting to check into their rooms. For some reason there was only ONE employee checking in people, but there were eight more standing around the lobby doing absolutely nothing. About ten minutes of this went by before three more employees showed up to check the guests in. Once the employees got logged into their computers, they only helped the guests in the regular line and ignored everyone in the SPG Gold & Platinum line until someone spoke up. It took 25+ minutes to get a room key. After settling into our room we came back down into the lobby an hour later and it was the same mess all over again - about 10-15 people waiting in line with only two employees checking people in (what happened to the third???). 
The doormen were particularly lazy too. I'm not really sure what these guys do. Sometimes I saw them helping people get taxis, other times I saw them just stand around talking to each other and watching other guests try to hail taxis on their own. When I pulled my car into the driveway, they didn't like the fact that I had parked on the left side (they were standing around doing absolutely nothing and didn't bother to wave my car into any particular direction) - instead they made me park on the right side, which also happened to completely block the front door of the hotel. When I was leaving the hotel the next day, there were two cars parked on the left side.
On the plus side, the concierge was very helpful. We asked for help in getting to a particular place for dinner and they pulled out a map and showed us how to travel there via the subway. 
It's pretty tough to find a good all-around Starwood hotel in Manhattan. The Times Square location is VERY busy and expensive, the W on Lexington Ave is very well run, but the rooms aren't as nice. This one should be the sleeper hotel of the bunch since the location is awesome, but unfortunately it's run poorly. Stay away until they get their act together.

title: “Another great Westin experience”
text: We took the bus from Providence to nyc. From the port authority bus terminal we walked maybe 10-12 blocks to get to the hotel which really was not bad at all. We got to the hotel early in the day tried to check in but being it was 5 his before check in time the room was not available which was expected. The front desk clerk was a little short with us I think maybe a little overwhelmed, there were only 2 clerks on and a line full of people. The bell men were very curtious and seemed genuine to enjoy their jobs. The hotel is very well located only a few blocks from all the action. The beds were super comfortable as always we slept like babies and the shower was again Heavenly. My brother in law even is looking to by the same shower head for his home, and I the heavenly bed. The only negative thing I can say is that the alarm clock was still set from the previous guest and went off at 5:30 am luckily with such comfortable beds we were all able to quickly fall back to sleep.

title: “Stayed twice here - both booked through Hotwire”
text: Have stayed twice at the Westin Grand Central - this used to be the New York Helmsley Hotel in Midtown East. The first time I stayed here, it was just at the beginning of the renovation and I had some issues checking in and with room, but those were related to the conversion. The second time, I stayed in August 2012 - I was there the day they re-launched the Westin. Pros: Great Westin rooms, Heavenly Bed, good amenities and service. Cons: no restaurant and bar when I stayed there (check with the Hotel), and the location is a little boring if you're looking for NYC excitement. All-in-all, decent hotel if it's the right area, and has all the Westin/SPG perks.

title: “It's mostly good”
text:
Stayed here for an anniversary weekend with my husband. This used to be the Helmsley Hotel and the location is great - 3rd Ave and 42nd - close to subway, easy walk to all the action in midtown. We asked for an upgrade (we're Gold Starwood members) and first the guy said he had nothing and then he said he had a nice room for us - the room was fine, perhaps a little larger than the usual NYC hotel rooms - it was a corner room so had a short hallway and a seating area. The bathroom was standard Westin quality with a walk in shower - but why does the tap have to be so far away that you get wet when you turn on the shower? As usual the bed was very comfy and the sheets of good quality. Our sheets were changed every day - something that does not seem to happen automatically any more. My pet peeve with ever Starwood I have stayed at in NYC is that there is often something missing after the room is cleaned - this time it was a bath mat one day. The staff must be under great pressure to get rooms done and they seem not to check when things are missing - or just don't go back to replace something.
That said, the hotel was recently redone so it is clean and shiny. The lobby does get very busy at times and it is quite small. I usually stay at the W on Lexington Ave and this is a very good alternative - I'd probably stay here in future rather than at the W which is getting old and tired. The gym here is also way better - large, clean with new machines.

title: “The bellman was right: 'yeah, keep hoping...'”
text:
The Westin Grand Central has potential, you can see they are trying (some of them) to make it better but it's not there yet. 
The location is superb, rooms are nice and relatively quiet. The service is so not top SPG: it seems they don't talk to each other, there must be resentment amongst the staff or maybe just disorganization.
Room ready way after 3.00 pm, late check out scheduled three times because apparently the first two were not recorded properly, SPG check in desk with a 'I wish I was not here' attitude. Yes, small things in the grand scheme but enough to make you tip-toe around the staff. 
I am a Gold SPG member: the Westin in Times Square staff & service has what the Grand Central does not.

title: “Great new Westin - great location, excellent value!”
text:
This hotel was the Helmsley, and became a Weston on or around October 1, 2012. It's not huge, about 240 rooms, and our room was a very comfortable size, extremely well equipped, and met all expectations of a four star hotel. We were on the fourteenth floor, and it was quiet and we slept well.
The location at first sight seems a bit "east" of most the main parts of the city. Once you get a hang of the fact that the Grand Central subway station is just a few hundred yards away, that you can bus or subway up or down Lexington - etc. you are no more than twenty minutes away from either the upper West Side, Downtown, Greenwich Village, and other major sectors.
You have to try the food court at Grand Central Station for gourmet dining on the trot and at great values - you name it, and it's available! The star of the dining is of course the Grand Central Oyster Bar - an institution that serves around 40 varieties of oysters, as well as many fresh fish items - not cheap but good value, about $30 a head excluding alcohol.

title: “Excellent room and value for this area; staff not so much”
text:
Stayed for a night in December 2012. Excellent renovation. All the comforts you expect from Westin - perfect bed (firm mattress with generous feather top), comfy linens, rain water shower, comfortable sitting area, great lighting. Housekeeping was spotless,robes, in-room coffee, in-room safe, huge flat-screen TV. It was also a great value - the room is massive compared to other mid-town hotels in this price range and above that I've stayed at. If you're looking for quiet, ask for a room on a high floor in the back - I would rather deal with 41st Street than the noise from the buses on 42nd Street.
While the building is up to Westin standards already, I can't say the same for the staff. We generally found them to be indifferent at best. I was particularly amazed by a member of the front desk staff who was outright rude until she saw that I was a Platinum SPG member and made a complete 180 to being syrupy sweet. 
FYI - There is no Club Lounge and the lobby isn't much of anything. There are maybe 3-4 benches. We saw people camped out on the floor because there was no place left to sit.
Have a great stay in NYC!

title: “Central location, good price”
text: Nice and clean rooms, modern hotel, centrally located, fair price value. - The bar is open till 4am, and even though food is not served after 10pm (why actually?), room service is available 24h. / Staff responds to complaints - What's missing? An executive lounge, where regular guests can print out a document without swiping a credit card in the outsourced internet corner...

title: “Poor Service.”
text: I stayed at this hotel on a Saturday night and made advance reservations. I arrived at 5:00pm to find the lobby was full of people; I assumed it was a convention going on at the hotel. When I tried to check in, they told me that my room wasn't ready yet, even though check in was 3:00pm. I realized the entire lobby was people waiting for their rooms. I finally got into my room at 8:00pm and found it was dirty. Someone I rode the elevator down with said her tv was still on, and there were half filled drinks in her room when she first walked in. They told me I'd receive a complimentary breakfast for my kids and I for the inconvenience. So we ate breakfast. Now, I've returned home, and found they charged me for the breakfast. I've called accounting, and they won't return my calls. I could call it worse, but giving every benefit of the doubt, this is still very poor service.

title: “Nicely renovated”
text: Just completed a business trip here and had a pleasant stay. The rooms are nicely renovated and provided a great night's sleep, although oddly the door doesn't have a tight seal with the frame and lets in light around the edges. Still a few kinks in customer service and housekeeping, but they are trying and the staff was very friendly. It took three tries to get working keys for my room, and on the third try they finally sent someone up with me and gave me points for the inconvenience. It should not command top dollar among the Starwood properties at this point, but if priced competitively I will definitely go back because the room was nicely sized and newly renovated, and the location has good access to most points in the city, plus the Grand Central amenities. Make a stop at the Duane Reade or CVS for water, however, because not even the Starwood rooms have a complimentary bottle.

title: “First Class”
text:
I booked two nights at this hotel at an exceptionally good price through Hot Wire earlier this year.
I ws rather concerned because of the reviews being posted.
The hotel is beautful - friendly helpful staff (every member) - restaurant opened for the first night while we were there - lovely meal well priced.
We were upgraded to a lovely room on 29th floor - as it was my husbands birthday we were treated to complimentary sparkling wine and chocolate dipped strawberries on the first night and compliementary sparkling water, and fruit and nut platter on the second night - well done Westin/
Great location but as our booking stated New York Helmsley there was a little confusion with the taxi driver as the Hotel name is now the Westin - but otherwise no problems at all - thank you.

title: “Fine If You Dont Mind Bad Service”
text: I've stayed at a lot of Starwood Properties, and they are always amazing. That's why I didn't think twice about booking at the Westin in NYC Grand Central. However, even though they assured me when I booked that I would get two adjoining rooms, when we arrive our rooms were no where near each other and the man behind the front desk sloppily chewed gum with his mouth open and lazily said there was nothing he could do. Then, one of our rooms ended up being near construction and was very loud, so when we asked to move rooms, another woman at the front desk was chomping on gum and said she would reserve another room and we should check back later. When we did check back, there was no room reserved and they had to scramble to find space for us. When we checked out, they even messed up on the billing and tried to charge us for an additional night. The only person that was helpful, informed, and not chewing gum was Pei, a very nice woman at the front desk that finally helped us. While the rooms themselves were not bad, the service was pretty shocking for a Westin, I expected at lot better.

title: “Amazing Views & Great Location”
text:
I stayed here on business/pleasure trip and it did not disappoint. We stayed on the 35th floor with great views of the city, river, and empire state building. The rooms were quiet, the beds are AMAZING, and the location is extremely convenient. There is a 24 hour CVS on the corner across from the hotel, so if you forget anything after a long day of sightseeing or business, it's easy to access. 
Also, if you are an active person traveling for a quick business stay, they have a program that allows you to rent New Balance workout clothing and shoes for just $5 for your entire stay. I called the night I checked in and they had the bag of gear to my room within 10 minutes. I've never stayed at a hotel with this kind of convenience, so I would definitely recommend Westin Grand Central to anyone.

title: “If you are Starwood Platinum Skip it”
text:
Thought I would try the newly renovated Westin Grand Central ( used to be the New York Helmsley) on a recent trip to Ny. While the renovation is nice - rooms pleasant enough - they have NO idea how to service their Starwood Platinum guests. I had submitted a suite night award request which they were not able to accommodate - I understand that - it was a busy week in NY. But their front desk staff Lily I think her name was told me while barely making eye contact that the property was oversold and they only had rooms with 2 double beds available and would that be okay. I said no it is NOT okay, I'm a lifetime platinum member, I've spent 86 nights this year at Starwood properties and I had a reservation for a King bed. She then was able to find one.
I will not be returning here for my 4 - 6 trips to New York per year. Stick with the W Union Square, the Parker Meridien or the W Times Square.

title: “Nice Size Rooms But....”
text:
The hotel has been up dated and is fresh and clean.
They lack the other touches. We stayed 3 days. When the maids cleaned the room they didn't replace things we had used such as plastic glasses etc. Our grandson stayed with us in our room. When we opened the pull out couch the sheet was dirty and there was no other top sheet or other beding. At 10:30 house keeping came up and brought clean linen. I asked them to make it up.
We wanted to check our baggage because we had to be out of our room at 12:00 and not leaving NYC until later in the evening. We waited in line 25 mins. We asked if someone could do it we were told no one was there that was union only they could touch the bags. Finally a nice lady showed up and took over by then there were 14 people in line waitng.
There is very little seating in the lobby to sit and wait for your ride.
Restrurant is open short time and very expensive. There is a nice deli next door.
Location is a ways from Time Square and the action.

title: “Great location!”
text:
What a great location, so easy to walk to Times Square, 5th Avenue, Broadway and to the subway!
We stayed here for three nights, and it was great! My partner asked if we could have a room with a view and we got the Empire State Building. We had a corner room on the 21st floor at the back of the hotel and although you could hear traffic noise in the distance it did not disturb our sleep. There is a subway exit next to the hotel, but a short walk and you are at Grand Central Station and that is just beautiful. When you step out of the hotel you can see the amazing Chrysler Building and next door to the hotel is the Daily Post building, as immortalised by the superman movies
The room was spacious with a massive comfy bed. We slept really well for the three nights we were there. There was a spectacular shower in the bathroom. Starbucks coffee was provided (although only 3 sachets a day). We did not eat at the Hotel and there are some great places to get breakfast nearby, a Starbucks over the road and another place next to the Hotel itself. There is a bank 2 minutes walk up the road and this also has the well known coffee shop inside it. There are some great restaurants nearby.
Our only problem was with the concierge, we wanted to book some tickets to see a film that was previewing in only two cinema’s in New York and asked for some help to reserve tickets online as we did not have a US credit card (just UK ones). It took the concierge 20 minutes to tell us they could only do this with our card which did not work.

title: “Much better than expected”
text: After reading some reviews on Tripadvisor, I was worried, but the construction is complete. The rooms were very nice and quiet. The bathroom was a little small, but clean. I would definitely stay here again. The bed and pillows alone were worth the stay.

title: “NYC Westin - Grand Central”
text: My husband & I visit NYC almost every year for the Macy's Day Parade. I reserved my room through Hotwire & booked The Westin. Drive up/drop off area w/guest parking at a reasonable fee, almost no wait at check-in, fast & corteous employees (please don't be turned off by the operator if you call a head for information) everyone was friendly at the hotel, large spacious rooms w/a bathtub if you have little ones....& the bell-hop even pointed out the view of The Chrysler building to our son....very sweet, fast check out & I even had a good laugh w/the attendant at the front desk:) Easy travel back out of the city heading towards the east side.

title: “Surprisingly large rooms; great location; nice views”
text:
Knowing this hotel had just recently opened up under the Westin brand (it was previously The Helmsley), I was expecting it to have a few kinks that needed to be worked out. Minus one issue with the elevators (which I'll detail below), I was thoroughly impressed with the property. When considering the high quality of the room furnishings, the large room size and the great location, I think this property is a wonderful value for Midtown. In my review I'll try my best to point out all the things I loved and the one or two things that could be improved upon at this hotel.
Things I loved:
-STYLE: The style and functionality of the room and hotel was top-notch. It is very clean and modern.
-LOCATION: The hotel is in a fabulous location. It's in midtown, only a few blocks from Grand Central Station and across the street from the Chrysler Building. It has a number of good breakfast locations nearby, as well as a CVS, Duane Reed and Bank of America. Just about anything I needed was within a block or two walk. 
-ROOM: In comparison to the standard cramped room sizes for NYC, our room was large. As you can see from my photos, the room had a small living area in it, which certainly made it feel more comfortable. The room also had numerous places to store our suitcases (one luggage rack; one stool), a full length mirror and a super comfortable bed. Our room had a view of the Empire State Building; my mother-in-law's had a view of the Chrysler Building.
-NOISE LEVEL: I heard noises here and there from the hallway, but nothing at all that was distracting, let alone would keep you awake.
Things to work on:
-INTERNET: Wi-Fi was available for $15, which is annoying. Blah.
-SERVICE: The front desk team could afford to smile here and there. We didn't use the concierge much, but they were helpful when we needed them.
-ELEVATORS: The hotel, which is probably 30 floors or so tall, has six elevators. However, during our stay three of them were not functioning, which meant that we often had to wait upwards of 20 minutes for an elevator since it was often too full to board. The concierge informed me that the computer system was cancelling the call for three of the elevators and that they needed a specialized engineer to fix it. I'm sure this is something that will not be a normal problem, but I cannot express just how big of an issue it was for our trip. 
All in all, this hotel is a definite contender if you're looking to stay in Midtown.

title: “Really should have been a Sheridan”
text: My family checked into this hotel on Thanksgiving. At the time of check in the regular guest line was shorter than the SPG line, so I went into the regular line and the clerk told me there were no rooms available and to wait. After 4 of us were standing in the small lobby with very limited seating for 1/2 hour, I saw there was no line at SPG and told my story tot he SPG clerk - she said she had a room ready fore me. Good thing I didn't rot on the vine waiting for the first clerk to accommodate us. Our room was fully remodeled, and it was nice, but not Westin nice.... it was more Sheridan nice. The gym was nice, however, no fruit in the fruit bowl. The wait for an elevator was acceptable, and a guest showed us how to hold down a combination of buttons to get an express ride down. All in all we thought the hotel was okay, but did not live up to our expectation of a $375, per night Westin.

title: “Technological gremlins”
text: Technology issues affected check-in, check-out, TV service and even the elevators. The apparent ongoing renovation is diminishing the allure of this centrally located property. Room accommodations are nice but the staff seems to be having a problem providing the level of customer service that one would expect. There didn't seem to be sufficient management available to deal with customers' issues. Was there really a need for 2 different members of the housekeeping staff to check on my room the day of my departure prior to 9:30AM? Signal loss while watching TV occurred so often that I gave up attempting to follow the dialogue.

title: “Comfortable stay”
text: This Westin is very well located, close to grand central, 5th ave shopping and time square. We were upgraded to a corner room which was very spacious, clean and comfortable. For a business hotel- located across the street from Pfizer headquarters- this hotel is poorly equipped. Who is paying $1 per min for internet these days??? And no hotel phone in the business center?

title: “Safety issue”
text:
Nice hotel, nice location, only one phone in the room, nothing in bathroom, phone in the room is so old and not working, asked them to change, they just re assemble it, not working, i feel unsafe if something happened , can not get help
Otherwise, fast internet
Be sure to have your soft slippers to use on the ceramic floor at the entrance of the room to avoid hurting your ankle
For 500$ per-night i am expecting higher quality.
Definitely not for romance or family

title: “Not a bad 5 star, good location”
text:
We stayed here recently on a trip from the UK, 4 nights, focused mostly on shopping and eating out.
I booked this hotel with points and generally try to stay in Starwood Hotels. Out of all of them in NYC, this one probably offered the best value for money, both quality and location-wise. I have stayed in the W mid-town before as well, but had big issues, so avoided that this time around.
We had a room on the 40th floor, fairly standard by the looks. The hotel has had a recent renovation from when it was the Helmsley, so was in good condition. 
What's good: Mainly the location and the fact that it has been recently renovated. Rooms are nice enough, though nothing special. The gym is good, new equipment and a good variety of cardio and weights. It's only a couple of blocks from Grand Central and there is good shopping both North and South of the hotel.
What's not so good: Bathrooms are small and lacking marble for it to feel like luxury. The restaurant out the front has not yet opened, so there's not a lot of options to eat in, or get a coffee during the day. 
Overall: There's been a lot of bad press about the lack of readiness and the poor service. This is probably deserved, but if you don't want anything except a clean room, gym, good location and reasonable price, then I would recommend this place.

title: “A great stay in Manhattan”
text: My husband and I stayed in this hotel in June 2012. During our stay the hotel was still under renovation to become a Westin Hotel. But we did stay in a new refurbished room. The room was really big with all the necessary amenities and a huge flatscreen TV and an extremely comfortable bed. Our room faced 42nd Street and we did hear some noice from the street... But I would really recommend this hotel for a stay in Manhattan.

title: “jekyll and hyde review”
text:
We stopped here for 5 nights over thanks giving and our stay was a little hit and miss. The problem with this review is, HAD we have paid the premium rate $896.00 per night we would have been pretty fed up! 
However, we booked through hotwire and got 5 nights for £400.00 ($600.00) or £80.00 p/n ($120.00) and as such its very difficult to complain with any real vigor!!!
The rooms are generally nice, with comfortable bed & surroundings, however the sound insulation from the outside (we were on lvl 8) was poor, the noise from the adjacent rooms bathroom was significant and the air con was quite loud and some of the finishes are not to a great standard (see pics).
The lobby was nearly always very busy and service was slow with staff often talking amongst themselves rather than acknowledge you. The bar/restaurants were still closed, the website says that bath robes & slippers are included (They weren't) however there was an iron, board & hair dryer.
On the plus side the hotel is in a great location, central to everything and close to Grand Central Station.
Please do not waste your money on the hotels extortionate wi-fi ($15.00 per day). Every Starbucks has free wi-fi and there are two, within 2 minutes of the main lobby!

title: “NICE HOTEL BUT STAFF ARE RUDE”
text: We stayed at this hotel Nov 23-26th. It's a nice hotel with nice rooms. Our check in was not what I expected at all. The woman who checked us in was very rude and not helpful at all with the questions I had about the hotel. It was like I was bothering them with my questinos. When we got to our room I was happy to see that is was clean and comfortable looking. The beds are good to sleep on. Nice flat screen TV. Limited chanels. You have to pay for wifi in your room but free in the lobby. The bathroom is small and there is no fan. The tub does not drain right so when you are showering you area standing in ankle deep water. Although we tipped our cleaner everyday for our room she did not do a great job. She never filled up soaps, toilet paper or wipped anything down. Do not eat at the hotel unless you have money to burn. Very expensive. Pax is next door and they have great food. Across the stree is a pharmacy/grocery and you can but your cold beer and drinks there. For the price they are asking at this hotel I would definately NOT recommend it. We booked through hotwire and got it for 250.00 per night. A little high for this hotel but overall it was decent. Time Sq is a 10 minute walk ( 6 blocks down 42nd then up 5 blocks.

title: “A Great Thanksgiving”
text:
This is a great hotel that was recently remodeled. There was limited restaurant availability as that is still being remodeled and will reopen soon. The rooms are huge for a NYC hotel and the staff was great to work with. They allowed my daughter early check-in as we were meeting from 2 different places. Everytime we had a question, it was answered promptly and accurately and the staff was quick to ask if you needed assistance. Check in was a breeze during a very busy time of the year.
It is within walking distance of Bryant Park and the Theater District although it is a little bit of a hike to the Theater District. The Metro and Grand Central Station are close which allowed easy access to anywhere you wanted to go. I would definitely stay here again.
When I travel, I have a hard time adjusting to a new place and the sounds of the area. We were on the 23rd floor and I slept like a baby from the first night on. They had the best beds. My only complaint is that you had long waits for the elevator during peak hours. Elevators were packed and you often had to wait for several cars before you were able to get on. Even then, you were packed like sardines because so many people were in each car. In some ways it was comical, but at other times, it made it hard to get to scheduled appointments.

title: “A great Surprise”
text: We spent 2 nights on a weekend at the Westin recently. We booked this hotel through Hotwire (midtown East neighbourhood) and got an excellent rate. The hotel is close to Grand Central Station which makes getting around a breeze. I emailed the hotel ahead of time requesting a king bed and although they did not respond to my email we were given the king. Check-in took some time but the staff was friendly. The concierge was extremely helpful and gave us some great dining tips. The room was a good size for NYC and very comfortable. We could see the Chrysler buiding from our window which was neat. The cab driver that brought us to the hotel did not know about this location so make sure you have the address handy. On the way back to the airport we took an airport bus. I can't remember the name of the company but they leave from Park Ave and 42nd st every 30 minutes to the airports. Ask the concierge about it.

title: “Nice hotel, great location”
text: I travelled to NYC in Nov to run the ill-fated New York Marathon as part of my 40th birthday celebration bucket list. Although disappointed that the marathon was cancelled (totally understandable) we still managed to havea great holiday. The hotel was part of a tour package, has a great location almost directly across the road from Grand Central Station and The Chrysler Building. Our room was large, clean and very comfortable. We had a super kingsize bed which provided for a great nights sleep. Any interacation we had with staff we found them to be very friendly and chatty and polite. We didn't eat in the hotel, Pax diner is next door and for an amazing breakfast try Pershing Square opposite Grand Central Station. Would definitely stay here again.

title: “Good location, service needed a little help!”
text:
Our family stayed here just a week ago for 4 nights nov 16-19, room was very nice. We got the best rate on Hotwire.com so I felt the value was good at 180.00 a night. Only small complaint was that we didn't have enough towels for all 4 of us and housekeeping took over an hour to deliver them. Other than that, location is good, overall meets the Westin standards with comfortable beds. NY was amazing and the close location was worth it! 
Times Square and Rockefeller plaza are less than a mile away, grand central station maybe 1 city block away. Definitely a good visit!

title: “Not too bad with good location”
text:
Stayed here from the 9th Nov to 18th Nov. Arrived pretty late in the evening at about 7pm. Check-in and check-out was a breeze despite the very busy lobby area. The room was newly refurbished and had a nice sweet scent to it. I stay in Westin hotels wherever I travel (SPG member) and to me, this was no different than the rest so there were consistency to it. However, the only drawback (as mentioned by some reviewers) were the housekeeping service. There were missing robes, missing towels and inconsistency in how the bathroom were cleaned. I ran out of facial tissues and it was never filled for the remaining 3 days of my stay. Hairdryer and iron was faulty after 2 days of usage - I did get replacement for the iron upon request but could not be bothered with the hair dryer as I had brought my own. Other than that, the room is totally comfortable. Noise is unavoidable as it is New York City after all. 
Location wise, this hotel is perfect. It was near most of the attractions and all that is needed is just to walk a couple of blocks west and you'll find almost everything. Food and convenience stores are abundance too. 
In summary, would stay here again as the rate paid was reasonable and comparable with other hotels in the city.

title: “Work in progress.”
text: Still undergoing renovation. Rooms great. Service a bit slow at check in. Elevators slow. We had low floor and had to wait sometimes 2 elevators. Restaurant not ready so breakfast buffet set up. Pretty lame. Expect things to get better. Should be great property if you want something south of Grand Central

title: “Needs to get its act together”
text:
Stayed here in mid oct, just when the hotel was officially changing name. We arrived around 5:30 in the evening, we had booked two rooms, neither of them were ready, we got one room about 8 and it was 10:30 when we got the key for the other room, the excuse was that Housekeeping was BUSY. This is a joke for the price we paid. Also no bar to have a drink and no restaurant. 
Definitely would not recommend this hotel

title: “Terrible, unfinished hotel with lousy service and deplorable attention to detail by the staff.”
text: This hotel while recently remodeled should not yet be open. We stayed a few nights and even though we did not leave the do not disturb sign on the door no one ever came in to take out trash, replace towels or clean up the room. At night, I wanted to go down for a drink but their restaurant / bar is not yet open. When we checked in we asked for a crib for our daughter and we waited for well over an hour to get it and it was already late. Overall, this is by far the worst Westin I've ever stayed at.

title: “Great stay for the Parade”
text: Arriving by train from CT and finding this Hotel was just across the street from Grand Central was a bonus. When we checked in at 11am and was given our room key was another bonus! I had reserved a room for 3 guests, a teenager was travelling with us but when I requested a room with 2 beds at check-in I was advise the room only had 1 bed but the agent said (with a smile) no problem I can give you a King bed with a sofa bed. Up on the 10th floor was a very clean spacious room with a great view and a sofa bed that was easy to pull out and was already fitted with extra linen. Smallish but very clean bathroom, lots of fluffy towels and delicious smelling bathroom supplies. A noon check-out allowed us to leave our bags in the room while we went to the parade and a good nights sleep gave us an early start to get a good spot ! Considering how busy the City and Hotel was we experienced very good customer service, especially from the concierge young lady who went out of her way to help us so we would make our train connection. Would come back time and time again for this Hotel and it's location.

title: “Good location, still needs work”
text:
The hotel is conveniently located a couple of blocks east of Grand Central Terminal on 42nd street. It was obviously recently renovated and is in good shape. When we were there, however, they had not quite gotten their act together which, for the price they charged, was unacceptable. 
The key to our room did not work the first time and we had to go get a new one at the front desk. The restaurant was not yet open, neither was the bar. I tried to use the minibar in the room but it was locked so I called the front desk who had to transfer me to the hotel manager to unlock it. He said he would do it remotely and that it should be unlocked in 2-3 minutes but the minibar remained locked. I just gave up in frustration.
The Hyatt adjoining Grand Central Terminal was offering rooms at the same rate. We should have stayed there instead.

title: “Just opened with a complete renovation...”
text:
Just reopened, I think it was under a different name, happy they changed to Westin. The room was the new Westin look, comfortable and classy and the views are great. 
The restaurant wasn't open yet and their meeting space is nice with natural lighting.

title: “Really good hotel in a great location”
text:
I took a quick trip to New York City broken up by a short trip out of town. I booked two nights on Priceline in the Big Apple. Both were presumably 4 star hotels and both were near train stations--one near Penn Station and the other, this one, near Grand Central.
The first one, near Penn Station, was a 2.5 star or 3 star at best. But the Westin delivered. Great rooms and great service. And since I was on the 7th floor, and close to city noise, I noted that it was quiet. 
I slept well. Felt like I was surrounded by quality. And will repeat.

title: “Comfortable”
text:
Stayed twice within a week recently. Good location, in easy waking distance of Grand Central and many of the main sights. Comfortable and well-refurbished rooms, surprisingly large for NYC. Corner room on top floor of the hotel was particularly nice (an upgrade as an SPG Platinum). 
Downsides? Lobby surprisingly small and chaotic, though, and hotel reception staff really not as friendly as they should be for a Westin. Pretty weak wireless internet in room. And rooms overlooking 42nd St are incredibly noisy.

title: “Great location...”
text:
I just stayed to this hotel Nov 18-19 for a shopping week-end with a girl friend. Great hotel, very clean, still look new! Comfortable bed, good size room with double beds (to have seen other hotels in New York or London!). Fridge was available in the room, with beer, wine, water (free), chocolate, cheese, ect. Free Starbuck coffee & coffee machine in room. The hotels also offers a luggage storage after you check out, good if you would like to do more shopping before leaving!
Down side: no wifi in the rooms, but wifi is available in the lobby and Business center (2 computers, you will be charge for use and printing). Also, during the might my friend's sleep was disturbed by the car noises & police/ambulance sirens... but I guess it is to be expected in a big city, even though we were a good 15-20 minutes walk from Time Square. Last thing, if you try to reach the concierge by phone, prepare to be put on hold for a while... You are better of just stopping by the concierge desk in the lobby.
Great location; close to Grand central, metro, bus & shuttle for airport, shopping, Rockefeller center. 
We did not eat at the hotel. Grand central station and surrounding area have lots of coffee/café places for breakfast & lunch...

title: “A good hotel”
text:
My wife and I stayed over a weekend in this hotel . The location of the hotel is great. Near to central besides near the Grand Central Station and subway. Broadway and 5th avenue are in walking distance.
The hotel is clean and looks brand new, probably went through a modernization. The rooms is spacious and very clean and nicely decorated. 
The lobby is a bit disorderly but we stayed just after Hurricane Sandy. So it is quite understandable that the staff were in their best mood and the physical conditions were tough.

title: “Newly renovated & close to everything!”
text: The hotel is newly renovated. The fixtures are very modern. The room was much more spacious than I expected. The concierge & other staff we're friendly & efficient. The location is great at just a few minute walk from Grand Central Terminal, 5th Avenue, restaurants, and other convienences. It is noisy outside the hotel, but it's the city, so what can you expect? No issues with noise from other guests. I recommend this hotel & would love to stay there the next time I visit NYC.

title: “Great Potential... Under Construction”
text: I stayed here over the weekend. This was previously a Helmsley hotel which is now going through a complete modernization. All the rooms are brand new and they are definitely up to Westin standards. The location in midtown is great! Unfortunately due to the construction, there is no lounge, restaurant or lobby that is open - except breakfast in the lobby restaurant and room service. There is no concierge lounge which I found surprising for a major hotel chain in NYC. This makes it basically a hotel with very nice rooms, but no NY vibe at all. I did use the new gym which is very large and well equiped. The concierge staff were excellent and all their recommendations were terrific. The room rate was competitive with other hotels of this caliber that were completely open and that is the rub. I did not hear any construction noise and there was no sign of the actual construction site, so it didn't feel like you were in a work zone. I would inquire before booking to make sure this meets your expectations.

title: “Perfectly located and brand new”
text:
This hotel is perfectly located within walking distance of Grand Central Station and Time Square. The room we had was modern, clean and well decorated. Bathroom was spotless. A bit expensive though. The restaurant and the bar were not open so we had to go out for a drink (Well, it's not too bad... we were in NYC, right?)
The concierge was very helpfull and found us the mos perfect restaurant in Little Italy.
There's a Starbuck on the corner so you can have breakfast there without paying 28$ per person.

title: “Amazing Experience”
text: I booked a one night stay for my 25th birthday night and I can not say anything horrible about the hotel. The location is superb and has easy access to the subway to get downtown. When we checked in the woman at the desk made sure that we felt comfortable and when we asked for a room with a view she gave us one. The rooms and hotel smelled wonderful and the rooms were beautifully decorated. The one complaint is the elevators were quite busy and sometimes had to wait a little for them but that wasnt really a big deal for my group. It was an amazing stay and I would definitely stay here again. The woman at the desk also offered us late check out since she knew we were going to be up late which I thought was really nice.

title: “Westin: Listen to advice from your guests”
text:
We stayed at the Westin for a four-day NYC vacation. We were with our two adult children in one room. Not your typical Westin standard.
Firstly, parking is $60 per day. ‘Nuf said but typical in the area.
