For compensation (!) we were told that the drinks in the fridge were free – except for alcoholic ones. Then some child-pleasing bubbles and other junk food were highlighted as complimentary. But the highly praised balcony by the manager turned out as faux balcony at daylight, about 5 inches deep.
At the first morning we realized that the linen had a hole and looked a bit tired.
On the next and final morning we found exact that hole again plus a lot of other holes in the linen. This was what you would expect in a waste bin.
Now we knew that the linen was not changed at least 2 nights – how long might it have been on the bed before we came? - even for $ 750.00 a night.
By checking out we claimed all these items and wanted an explanation which we did not received nor any way of “sorry for that”, but lots of excuses.
This experience with a hotel claimed by some critics as best of New York is a shame. Your organization should check the quality standard and the service. It is miles away from the level of a being accepted as member of the “L HW”.
Sincerely 
Dr. Georg Gebhard

title: “Serenity in the Big City”
text:
Very warm and comfortable hotel in Tribeca.
Not noisy and full of "Party-ers" like some other downtown hotels.
Locanda Verde is a top 10 restaurant in all of NYC.
Rooms are a little small, but nicely furnished.
Library in Lobby Level is a great place to have a coffee or drink (or a small business chat)

title: “Amazing hotel in New York”
text:
My husband and I stayed at The Greenwich Hotel for a week in June.We searched through trip advisor for somewhere to stay in the Greenwich, Tribecca area and were very pleased we managed to get a room here. This hotel doesn't look much from the outside (you could actually miss it ) but inside it has the luxury of a home away from home.
The rooms are very spacious, modern with a homely feel and have everything you need for a relaxing stay. The huge bed was really comfortable, the bath was amazingly deep and filled in a really short time. As others have said the free mini bar(excluding alcohol)and the lovely snacks were a great treat at the end of a full on day exploring New York.
What we really loved about this place was it's position. Close to the Hudson river where we could go walking in the morning,surrounded by some of the best Restaurants in NY and close to the subway but far enough away from the hustle and bustle to relax in the evening.
The outdoor garden was lovely. A great place for a glass of wine in the evening or breakfast in the morning. Also the guest lounge was very inviting with its huge overstuffed couches and comfy chairs and the fire place gave it just the right touch of ambiance.The restaurant down stairs was delicious but not cheap.
I would recommend this place to anyone wanting a great NY experience and the chance to catch a celebrity or two.(we did).We will definitely return if we make another trip to NY.
The staff were friendly and helpful and although we didn't use the pool it looked inviting.

title: “top tier hotel experience”
text:
I'm a frequent business traveler. New York is always hard because rooms are typically small, and the prices are high. While I certainly had to pay a lot for my room (a couple of steps up from the bottom tier pricing), the decore was gorgeous, everything was clean and new.
I've spent some time at the hip Ace hotel and will never go back there now that I've found the Greenwich. It's a true class act without a bunch of loud 20-somethings running around.
Hard to beat the nicely portioned free mini-bar.
Courtyard for breakfast and evening drinks with colleagues was great.
Checkin/out is no fuss; very simple and quick. Professional staff all the way around.
My only complaint would be that, as an early riser, I was generally the first patron to arrive for breakfast and they weren't fully prepared and I felt like I causing everything to get going which wasn't ideal.
I'll absolutely be back! Great location (just blocks away from the Hudson River greenway thing where you can go running. I'll likely bring family with me (spouse and 2 kids) as there's an amazing playground thing on said greenway.
Oh yea, the sub-terrainean pool is ultra cool.

title: “Fantastic!”
text:
I stayed at The Greenwich for my Birthday recently & had an amazing stay! The hotel is located in Tribeca, a lovely, calm neighborhood in NYC, set on a cobblestoned st. I arrived early around 11am, & my room was ready. I had never stayed at the hotel before, & while the Front Desk Agent who checked me in was nice, I wasn't given an info. on the hotel, etc. I'm quite familiar w/ the property, so this wasn't necessary for me, but just something to mention. To access the elevator, you must use your key, which I wasn't aware of until I figured this out (this is something that should have been mentioned...again, just a note) My room (#503) was on the 5th fl. & incredibly quiet, lovely & super in terms of design, colors, etc. I loved my room! The pale yellow walls, clean hard wood floors, amazing Duxiana bed, soft sheets, & amazing bathroom done in beautiful Orange & White tiles were all great! The mini-bar was extremely well-stocked & all items were complimentary, with the exception of the wine & liquor. Everything was provided from Mexican Coca Cola, Fiji Water, Pineapple Juice, Ginger Ale, to a lovely basket of snacks, including Kettle Chips, Cookies, Nuts, Swedish Fish, etc....I thoroughly enjoyed the mini-bar & it was so nice to have it all included! nice touch guys!
The Desk area was spacious with outlets, & nice bookshelves w/ a cool selection of books, objects, & a little jar of candy! so nice! The Flat screen T.V. had clear reception, the sitting area had a comfy sofa, the windows opened which was great, the A/C made the room incredibly cold, which I love, & the closet was spacious, with a safe, slippers, padded hangers, etc. The bathroom had an absolutely amazing waterfall Rain Shower that was truly the best I've had in a hotel!!! I never wanted to get out.....the deep-soaking tub was also pure bliss! The Red Flower products have a lovely masculine scent & I also loved the soap. The towels were super great, the Frette robes were cool for the Summer & the light fixtures above the sink were amazing! The WC is in a seperate alcove which is nice. The pressure in the shower & tub were 100% flawless! 
I just loved the overall feeling of my room....light, airy, cool & beautifully unique in terms of design & colors! The rug was also great....so many unique, special touches in the room! I was celebrating my birthday, so the hotel sent a lovely card w/ Champagne(which I don't drink, so they sent a cupcake-thanks alot!) A welcome note from the hotel w/ 2 Oatmeal Sandwich cookies were awesome!!! The lobby & drawing room w/ outdoor courtyard were great & my meals from Room service were amazing! great food & arrived very quick. 
Everything was absolutely perfect during my stay! All bellmen were very nice & charming, Matt at the front desk granted me a late 1:30pm check-out that was much appreciated & Lauren & Jonathan were very nice, as well at the Front Desk. I loved the hotel & will def. be back soon! 
Best,
Patrick 
NYC

title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in.”
text: Walking into the Greenwich is amazing. From the outside you wouldn't even look twice but similar to many things in NYC the true beauty is going inside and exploring. There is an amazing pool (the only complaint could be that it would be great if it were heated) - and steam room. All of the common areas oozing old Hollywood charm. Considering that Robert De Niro owns the hotel this doesn't come as a massive shock - his taste is classy and inviting. The service was impeccable, the room was amazing and the whole place was complete luxury. We saw many movie stars there including Ted Danson and Cameron Diaz. Perfect place to celebrity watch.

title: “Edgy, unassuming, & elegant!”
text:
We thought this was a very nice and friendly establishment. There is a beautiful, brick courtyard with all sorts cool plants in different containers right off the main lobby. I had lunch out there from the Italian restaurant next door, and it was delicious. Later in the evening, my husband and I sat in the courtyard and had a cocktail while he smoked a cigar. The rooms are all different. The first room they gave us looked out onto Greenwich Street, and since I didn't care for the view, I asked to see another. They were happy to oblige, and showed me another room (which was an upgrade) that looked onto Franklin St, and I choose that room. Some of the rooms have soaking tubs, while others only have a shower, which was the case in this room. However, the shower was awesome, with cool, Moroccan tile and a large "railhead" shower head. The floors are all wooden, the hallways are darkened, it's very quiet and wonderfully decorated. I was told most of the paintings in the lobby were painted by Robert De Niro's father. The hotel used to be a parking lot, and it took 4 years to complete, with over 20 styles of brick used in the construction of the hotel.
 Tip: because we used our AMEX platinum card to book our reservation (July '11), Greenwich gave us an automatic room upgrade, $25 per person voucher for breakfast, and a $100 voucher for a spa service. 
 I booked a spa service for the following morning, which I enjoyed very much. The spa is in the lowest level and has a nice gym, also. There are unisex bathrooms/locker rooms each with steam rooms and showers. You walk through here to get to the pool area, which is beautiful. The water was a tad murky, and I know they were working on the water issue as I saw a maintenance man talking to the pool attendant. I would have given the pool 5 stars if not for the murky water. 
 The people who work here were all super friendly. We can't wait to come back!

title: “Fabulous place to stay in NYC”
text: My husband and I stayed here when we attended a premiere at The Zeigfield Theatre.We enjoyed all the details that made this hotel seem like a home away from home.We loved the lounges that seemed like a living room and they are only available to the people who stay in the hotel.The restaurant Locandii Verdi was great.We had dinner and breakfast there.The staff at the coffee shop was very accommodating with every request.It was a lovely unique boutique hotel.

title: “We warmly recommend”
text:
We stayed in the Greenwich hotel to celebrate my husbands birthday. We really loved the great service of all the staff. The spa was wonderful and we went for a swim every evening after walking all day around the city. 
The rooms were very big and comfortable. We definetely recommend this hotel!

title: “Terrific hotel, great location - loved it”
text:
My wife and I spent a weekend at the Greenwich Hotel last month. It was terrific, and we will definitely stay there again on our next trip. Location is great - 1 block from the Hudson River and great walking/jogging trails along the river, great neighborhood full of small cafes and boutiques and interesting shops.
Our room was very nice. We loved the interesting but comfortable furniture, and the great bed. The rooom felt cozy and comfortable, but also hip and interesting. Appreciated the complimentary soft drinks, snacks, and large water bottles - a nice touch, and so refreshing for a hotel to actually include something "extra" with your room.
The hotel has a lovely courtyard where you can eat a quiet breakfast (and other meals if you like). Service in the courtyard was a little slow, but not annoyingly so. I just think the place has a laid back feel about it, and who wants to rush when you are sitting on a comfy couch in a pretty courtyard drinking good coffee. We had a very good Sunday brunch meal here. 
Oh, and the spa is worth a visit. We had a short couples soak in the Japanese tub, which was glorious and I only wish we had booked a longer soak, followed by great massages. The pool area is serene!
I enjoyed the Greenwich Hotel. Staying there, I felt lucky and privileged.

title: “Tribeca gem”
text:
The Grenwich is a great hotel. The rooms are interestingly decorated and well appointed. It feels less like a big city hotel than like a very well designed and staffed private members club.
The location, in Tribeca, is great for downtown, and for restaurants and bars. Less good, of course, if you are in NYC for Fifth Avenue shopping, Central Park etc. But Manhattan is a small place, and everywhere is in reach.
The food and bar at the Greenwich are absolutely outstanding. the restaurant in house, Locanda Verde, does some of the best Italian food I have eaten - it would be one of the very best restaurants in Bologna, Rome or any other foodie Italian city.
The small touches at this hotel, like the free minibar and constantly replenished basket of very fun old-school American snack (things like Smuckers, as well as normal M7Ms and other typical brands) really make a difference.
There is one weakness I think the Greenwich hotel has compared to the traditional five star hotels like the Plaza, Ritz Carlton et al is with the concierge. I felt that as a smaller and more recent hotel the concierge desk did not have the contacts or the pull to make hard to get reservations with restaurants in the city. We asked for a few reservations that weren't possible, and, although I can't be certain, I think the concierge at one of the big name city hotels might have been able to make it happen.
However, this is a minor weakness in a very excellent hotel, and I would happily recommend it to anyone for either a holiday or for business.

title: “Interesting and pleasant despite small room”
text: The design and location of the hotel are interesting (in a good way) and much thought has clearly gone into appointing the rooms, which are efficiently laid out but have much character. Perhaps it is a feature of New York, but the size of the rooms is a problem (mine was fine, but it was in the middle of the price range, so I can't imagine what the smaller ones are like.) The service is a little haphazard, with many of the attractive staff clearly not chosen for their ability to solve problems. The lounge for guests only (a great touch) is wonderful, even more so because one can order from the restaurant menu but be removed from the bustle of the restaurant itself. Not cheap.

title: “This is the one look no further!!!!!!”
text:
Well, I cannot fault this slice of HEVEN!
Five Nights of Tranquil Luxury, and Oh my god the beds - Hugh! Comfortable! Fantastic Linen! I am trying to source this as I have to have some. This is not an inexpensive hotel and it was a special occasion for my wife and I, we were not disappointed. Best service I have ever had in a hotel and all unobtrusive and professional. Rooms are great value in a city that puts a premium on space. The Japanese Spa is sublime. Every morning up early down to the pool swim fifty or so lengths have a steam, shower then back up to the room to have breakfast. There is a full gym if you are so inclined. Great start to each day before enjoying the delights of NYC. I even had a massage by one of the Japanese Masseuses, I felt like I had been origami’d ……Wonderful. My wife tried other spa delights and was impressed and that is saying a lot!!! Fabulous location. Great Italian restaurant/bar. as only NYC seems to do. By now you must think I’m Robert de Niro (Owner) yes that Robert, but I ask you if I was, would I not have better thing to do!!! It’s all in the details Robert, Good work! you can give up the day job - we will be back…..

title: “Ah, this is more like it”
text: What a lovely hotel. Everything about this hotel is quietly understated and absolutely wonderful. There are many wonderful hotels in NY but for me this is the one.

title: “What a fantastic hotel”
text:
This is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in - if not the best!
Service was top-notch right from my late post-midnight arrival. Decor is fantastic. Remarkably quiet. Great bed. 
You really get the sense that they want to go the extra mile here. The complimentary minibar and (loads of) snacks is a brilliant detail that means more than you'd think. 
The rooms are "rustic" with part wooden floor and part old furniture, but it's all been refurbished as e.g. the beautiful old closet had lights installed. 
Bathroom was just a work of art!
And don't even get me started on the restaurant. Best. Pasta. Ever!
Definitely coming back as soon as I can defend the slightly elevated price on my expenses.

title: “great place great stay”
text: My wife and I wanted to get away for a day and chose to stay at the Greenwich. It's not cheap, but if that's not your governing factor, then I can recommend it unconditionally. The people at the hotel were casual but extremely friendly. All we cared about was the quality of the room and it didn't disappoint. The aesthetic is an interesting blend of tribeca zen rustic chic (if that makes any sense at all) with some buddha statues, wide plank wood floors and funky light fixtures. The bed is super comfortable, the bathroom was cool and the room hit all the right notes. We had a superb dinner at locanda verde which the hotel kindly made a reservation at for us and we blissed out for a night of great sleep. We will return.

title: “Loved the common areas decor, but not much else”
text:
Stayed for a weekend and found the location of the hotel was not as convient as those in SoHo. I was shown a nice sized room with a balcony. Unfortuately was awakend by horrible cigeratte smoke coming from under the door. I was moved to a much smaller room the next night. Had brunch in the drawing room. Had horrible service. Had to ask for my coctail 3 times. The bathrooms are so dark, could not put on makeup. They really need lighted mirrors.
I must say the doormen that hailed my cabs were great.

title: “Gem in a great neighborhood”
text:
As a frequent traveler to NYC, I am always looking for new, comfortable places to stay. The Greenwich fits the bill and more. The hotel is quiet, intimate....and hip.
My budget does not allow me to stay in a larger room but have frequently gotten upgraded. I love the cozy room that face the courtyard with small balconies. Makes me feel as if I am in a little apartment.
The living room area that is open only to guests, as well as the outdoors garden, are perfect spots to meet with others or work. Service is great....and you can order from the attached restaurant Locande Verde.
Lots of great dining options within a few blocks and Soho shopping is not too far.
As a business traveler I find this place to be a great getaway. If you are working in mid-town you will need to give yourself time to travel but it is worth it.
Lastly - the fitness center and spa are top notch for a boutique hotel.

title: “I will never stay anywhere else”
text:
My husband and I stayed at the Greenwich Hotel over Thanksgiving. Previously we have stayed at Soho Grand, The Essex House and Hilton and we have had great experiences at all of the hotels. But the Greenwich Hotel is just out of this world! Everything was so great!!! Beautiful hotel, amazing spa, super-nice staff and I could go on. The only bad thing about the hotel is that we didn't want to leave it... I am already planning another trip to New York just to stay at the hotel.
I would sincerely recommend it to everyone!

title: “Great Hotel”
text: We have spend 5 days in New York and the first time at the Greewich Hotel, The hotel is fantastic, the spa as well, great restaurant and fantastic brunch on Sunday

title: “Luxurious and homely hotel with excellent service to match”
text:
This hotel has a real homely feel to it and like other reviewers have commented it really does feel as if you are staying at somebody’s house. 
On arrival we were shown to the hotel bar and served some complimentary coffees – actually it’s not a bar it’s far too homely and comfortable to be called a bar. We were seated near the open log fire – what a treat that is when it’s freezing outside. 
We were upgraded to a larger room which was like a suite with a large bathroom with walk in rain shower. All drinks and food in the mini-bar were complimentary (apart from alcohol). All the staff were incredibly down to earth and very friendly and helpful especially Jonathan who always had a smile on his face as he greeted you. 
We ate at the hotel restaurant which was always packed (a good sign). The restaurant food was very high quality and the service matched the hotel. Sometimes when you’re eating in a very busy restaurant the service can lapse – not the case in the Locande Verde. They also have an interesting selection of Italian wines. 
The pool , spa and gym areas are also fantastic. We had the pool to ourselves most of the time and it has a very eastern (Thai) feel to it. The gym is modern and well equipped. 
The location (Tribeca) is a quiter area than Soho but there’s still lots of interesting places to eat and drink. We went to the Terrior Tribeca which is an excellent bar / restaurant where you can sample many different wines from around the world. 
I could go on … but it’s all good and I have nothing but high praise for this hotel. We stayed 2 nights here and then transferred to the Mercer in Soho (see my review also). The girl on reception told us that the Mercer is good but not as good as the Greenwich. They are different hotels and both excellent in their own way but there’s no doubt that I would return to the Greenwich everytime. Thank you very much Mr De Niro.

title: “I truly did not want to leave...”
text: Well, this will be my home away from home from now on when doing business in NYC. If you like attention to detail and being made to feel very special, then you'll like it here also. Business travelers, do yourself a favor and reward and try out the Greenwich instead of the same old same old. I had no wants here, everything I could possibly need was provided perfectly. The staff were universally wonderful and also very attractive. My room was a study in detail, not ostentatious but always left me with a feeling of being taken care of so perfectly. The volume of water the shower put out was sinful! The dux bed was perfect, the Italian linens luxurious, the food was delicious, free non-alcohol drinks and snacks just great. If you are traveling for business and want to feel all warm and happy returning each night to your hotel after a long work day, then do yourself a favor and give the Greenwich a try.

title: “A gorgeous understated luxury retreat”
text: I have now stayed at The Greenwich Hotel twice since it has opened and have had a fantastic experience both times. I have traveled all over the world for both business and pleasure and tend to prefer and intimate hotel experience and this hotel does not disappoint. I always state this as being in my top three favorite hotels in the world thus far. I have stayed in both the smallest room, the Courtyard rooms as well as a larger Superior room. Both of these rooms are large by New York standards and both feel like you are staying at someone's comfortable understand wonderful home. The library lounge and the restaurant are both fantastic as well. The only downside is the price as I would stay there much more often, however it is very worth it.

title: “Fab hotel”
text: We stayed at the Greenwich for 3 nights at the end of our honeymoon which we had spent in the Caribbean. We had such a great time here and loved the hotel. We spent so much time researching where was best to stay and we were so pleased with our choice. In the end we chose this over the Mercer and are really pleased we did. The Greenwich has loads of charm, the bedrooms are great, the bathrooms amazing. We loved the touches such as a whole box of American goodies in our room each day and champagne we were left on the first night. We only ate at the hotel before we caught our flight on the last day - the food was fantastic and we really wish we had eaten there before. The staff are really friendly and the service is overall very good. There was a bit of noise around our room during the night a couple of times which was annoying but other than that this is such a great place to stay. Good location, great swimming pool and gym etc if you want to use it. Would highly recommend and would definitely go back when next in NYC.

title: “A genuine home from home but quieter and with great service”
text:
You get what you pay for and whilst the Greenwich isn't cheap you get something other hotels need to aspire to - ultra quiet luxurious rooms with truly excellent service and a touch of class. 
So you know our type of hotel, our other NYC visits have included the Soho Grand (nice but moody staff), Tribeca Grand (nice but noisy), 60 Thompson (average) and the Hudson (cool but tiny tiny rooms).
Our stay started with a swift paperless check-in and personal escort to the room. Fast Wi-Fi, snacks (sweets, crisps etc) and all mini-bar soft drinks are included in the rate - a nice touch and takes away the feeling of being ripped off or worried about using the facilities. We were upgraded too - from a superior to a deluxe - not quite sure why :-).
The room itself was 7th floor facing North Moore St. Big comfy bed, soft pillows (harder ones were provided on request), plenty of space, deep bath, big telly, robes and an extra door to keep corridor noise out. I can't emphasise how quiet this hotel was. House keeping were ultra discreet and never seen (in fact we saw them actually hiding at one point!).
A DVD player and movies were available, the pool was breath taking, the breakfast was delicious and room service was excellent with orders arriving within minutes for easy things and on time for larger orders.
Location is great if you like the quiet side of New York. Tribeca is like a different country compared to Time Square etc.
The photo's on the site don't overstate what you get - lovely design and all really comfy and cosy.
The only downsides are (and these are aimed at hotel management really as quite picky)...
- With the room being hard to leave it would be nice to have tea making facilities
- The restaurant temperature was either really cold (to the point of having to wear a coat on two occasions) to really stuffy
- Soft close toilet seats - every hotel needs em!
All round top class and will go again.

title: “very good, just slightly too cool”
text:
I accidentally booked a room at both the Ace Hotel and the Greenwich one weekend, and after checking out the Ace I moved immediately to the Greenwich, which is vastly superior to the Ace (if much more expensive). The room I saw at the Ace was dark and cold-feeling, whereas the Greenwich feels like a warm if slightly spartan room in a rich friend's European lodge. I loved the comfy bed, the spaciousness of the room, and the sophisticatedly simple decor. That said, the Greenwich didn't feel entirely ideal to me. The wood finishings in the hallways look too new or something-- they seem to be going for an old lodge feel, but in that case they need to have that heavy wood piney smell, and they don't, so it just feels weird (perhaps this is because I grew up going to old lodges in the mountains that all had a very heavy scent of pine). The hard wooden floors were cool but like the hallway, felt like they needed some age or heft or something, or maybe just some warmer, furry area rugs-- something to warm up the space just a bit.
Things I liked: I loved the shower, very luxe. The pool and steam room were also luxurious. The library room on the first floor was beautiful; I made sure to stop there every evening on the way in to my room. Generally speaking, I slept well and felt warm and coddled by the space, if just slightly less comfortable than I would have felt had they somehow solved the new/hard surfaces problem.

title: “A fantastic time”
text: We stayed at the Greenwich hotel and everything was absolutely fabulous. The rooms were great, the staff of the Hotel was very nice and friendly and this is without any doubt a place to go back to as soon as possible.

title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
text: I recently spent a night here. The room was nice. Furniture was high quality. Nice bathrooms. All the non alcoholic things in the mini bar were free. Staff was courteous. Kind of a hip ambiance. Nice bar. Very convenient for TriBeCa, not so much for other destinations. Not cheap but I guess about typical for NYC.

title: “like staying at your rich uncle's place...”
text: ..if your uncle is Robert de Niro, has a penchant for things Eastern, and has transported and rebuilt a full-scale Japanese bath house in his basement. This is my favourite hotel in New York - it thoroughly deserves it's Hot Pink rating in the neilsonparc lust list. The indoor pool is one of the best, if not THE best, in the world, the bar is cool, the bathroom (Moroccan style) is awesome.

title: “Best of New York”
text: This hotel is a gem ! Impeccable service, great ambience. You feel as if you are in the private townhouse of a very stylish and wealthy friend. No affections, and no attitude. The spa and Locanda Verde especially are delightful as is the courtyard and library.Incredible attention has been given to detail designwise, it is really one of a kind. Am already planning my next overnight at the Greenwich.

title: “Manhattan Oasis”
text: The Greenwich Hotel in TriBeCa is an elegant hotel with European charm. What stands out in my memory is the cozy lobby with a roaring fire place, the bare wood floors with area rugs, the deep soaking tubs. And the subterrainian pool that they will open any time of night. Of course the kid loved the giant fish bowl full of candy for which the hotel does not charge a penny. The hotel restaurant is also great.

title: “O-A-S-I-S!!”
text: The Greenwich has quickly become our FAVORITE hotel in NYC!! Regardless of where in the city our destination is.....we LOVE it there!! Stepping through the doors...you feel immediately welcome....front desk staff has always been lovely...and although our room is always ready immediately....we will often choose to have a cocktail in the beautiful library first !! The pool and spa are absolutely beautiful....the rooms perfectly appointed!! (the only problem are all of the "treats" you are obligated to sample in the "goody bin")...Did I mention the shampoo/conditioner and soap???????? I absolutely recommend!!

title: “favorite place in the city”
text:
I have stayed at the Greenwich several times, both with friends as well as my spouse. Every stay was a wonderful experience ! The staff have always been very friendly & accommodating. The rooms were all different and extremely relaxing & private. Luxury abounds, from the tile bathrooms to the bedrooms. 
My favorite place in the hotel is the "library" ! Very romantic place for drinks & even dinner....

title: “Absolute Perfection”
text:
First off, I must to say, I’m shocked to read reviews about a lack of atmosphere or inadequate service. I just got back from an amazing 4 night stay at the Greenwich Hotel that was nothing short of perfection. The staff was warm and welcoming; the drawing room and courtyard were charming; and my room was simply wonderful (the bathroom was especially amazing- gorgeous deep soaking tub). The overall vibe was more genuine and intimate than any other boutique I’ve visited in Manhattan. I find that sometimes the “luxury” category can carry a degree of pretentiousness that clouds a more honest charm. The Greenwich is defined by this charm. 
I’ve stayed in NYC a good amount over the past 20 years and am thrilled to have found what is truly a hidden gem. As a self proclaimed veteran of the New York hotel scene, the Greenwich earns my highest recommendation. There is no doubt I will be back.

title: “Absolutely Amazing & Beyond Expectations”
text: This hotel was a recommendation from our friends who stayed here quite a few times and for also their anniversary - they absolutely love The Greenwich. We usually stay at the Mercer but decided to give this hotel a try. A few days prior to arriving at the hotel, I called to make a few requests and spoke with a gentleman who said his name was Matt. We explained to him that we tried to book the restaurant "Locanda Verde" but was unsuccessful and told that there was no tables available. He was able to confim our reservation for the restaurant with no problem and also help me make a decision on a show to see while on our trip to New York - he too helped us get the show tickets and great seats. It was raining quite a bit and when we arrived at the hotel, we were ushered from our taxi into the hotel by one of the doormen who was waiting with a courtesy umbrella welcoming us to the hotel. Our check-in was a breeze. We receive warm smiles & a friendly welcome. We were showed to our room by Katie who was a doll. She answered all our questions and alleviate a few concerns. In all our first time staying here was magnificant. I can honestly say that The Greenwich is our new home away from home.

title: “not up to expectations - a little disappointing”
text:
I thought the Greenwich would compare to the Mercer in service, atmosphere and amenities...but unfortunately it is very difficult to find anything that makes the Greenwich stand out; except for the free snacks and non-alcoholic drinks in your room.
the biggest issue with the hotel is it lacks atmosphere; first time I stayed in a NYC hotel and didn't look forward to spend a night in the bar. Everything feels so "slow" and boring.
La locande verde: very atypical breakfast menu and very inflexible so ended up taking my breakfast outside the hotel. 
Spa: impressive swimming pool (unfortunately "in repair" during my whole stay) but services are not unique and wildly over-priced (go to the Mandarin Oriental for a really impressive experience if you are willing to pay these prices)
Room: lacks imagination; bath tub too small. Good sized products are a plus. The main problem with the room though are the floors; they make an incredible noise...
Staff was okay although "no way" they could arrange a late check-out.
also, booked transportation service from/to the airport and never have seen such an expensive service.
So, unfortunately, I will not return to the Greenwich. if you want to test it for yourself, make sure you get an incredible deal.

title: “Terrific!”
text: Loved this property. All aspects were excellent and well done. Restaurant within (Locana Verde) was tough to get into but well worth the wait.

title: “Amazing Hotel - Sloppy Staff - Wont Stay Again...”
text: Greenwich Hotel has many fantastic features - my room was lovely with a very comfortable bed and great interiors - the drawing room and courtyard room were relaxing and intimate and the restaurant was fun and had great food - all was going great BUT.... what the hell went wrong with the Reception staff?? The girl that checked us in was chewing gum like a cow and no one was wearing uniforms or name tags despite about 4 people standing behind the reception desk and looking at me like i had just rudely interrupted their conversation - what a crap way to be introduced to the hotel - especially when paying $500+ a night and hoping that the greeting would be much more personal and professional - i felt like i was checking into a back packers hostel. This unwelcoming vibe from the reception staff was hard to escape during our stay - which is such a shame because i wont stay again despite the hotel being truly beautiful. Oh and by the way - expect to be barked at if you take any photos in the hotel - a notice would be sufficient - but the reception staff really dont want you to capture any memories of your stay at the hotel...(good and bad)

title: “Very relaxing oasis in New York”
text:
I had never stayed in Tribeca before and was completely charmed by it; I usually stay at the Mercer but have found that Soho can sometimes be very crowded and busy. Tribeca does not have anything like the same number of shops and, as a result, it has a much more laid back feel. And this hotel is just such a relaxing place to stay. The rooms are very nicely done; the bathrooms are gorgeous, but most of all the bar and courtyard reserved for guests are ideal places to while away the time insulated from the hustle and bustle of New York. And the food in the courtyard is excellent too. 
I liked the way one could walk up to Soho in 10 minutes or over to the waterfront (with its fabulous views) in 5. I loved all the restaurants nearby especially Harrison which always seemed to be buzzing with happy diners. But if I wanted to stay in, there was always the courtyard to retreat to and it was especially magical lamplit at night-time. 
I did not find the staff to be at all offputting (as other reviewers have suggested)- they were generally very professional and warm. 
If I had a complaint it was that I thought the sound proofing was poor for a hotel of this standard but earplugs at night blocked out the noise of creaking wooden doors and corridors and also the occasional noise of traffic outside. And I suppose that noise is one of the occupational hazards of a city like New York.

title: “Great hotel but front of house staff with attitude”
text:
We have just returned from five nights at this hotel - the hotel itself is great, great location - lots of restaurants around and very quiet at night - best of all is the mini bar and basket of goodies which are all free (except alcohol) and replenished daily. 
Unfortunately our stay was marred by unhelpful and rude front desk staff, we had a problem with our special travel mastercard which we had charged up with dollars - because you get a better rate - on arrival we gave the card, but what we did not know was that the hotel 'reserves' $200 a day on top of the room charge (so an additional $1000 in our case) - the result was that all of the money on our card was in effect used up and the following day we tried to use it and it was declined - after talking to the card company we discovered what the hotel had done - completely without telling us - the hotel said it was a standard thing to do, we have travellled all over the world and have never come across this - i'd be interested to hear if anyone else has ? we would not have minded if we had been told but sorting out the result of this took 3 days as the money did not go back on the card so could not be used - anyway, the point is how the staff dealt with the situation - it is like dealing with robots, they were very fake and pretended to understand - it was very frustrating - as someone else said in a review, the particular person who dealt with us was confrontational and comletely unhelpful. Stay at this hotel but be wary of the front desk staff and dont excpect help if you have any problems.

title: “Best hotel in NYC”
text: Absolute delight! The room was spacious, clean, and stocked full of goodies. Nothing was missing. The shower was heavenly, including the beautiful soaps. Won't ever stay anywhere else again when visiting NYC.

title: “Tribeca jewel that offers intimacy and old world charm with uneven front of house staff”
text:
Chose Greenwich Hotel based on rave reviews from friends. Unfortunately, my check-in experience marred my impression of the hotel. Although I had a confirmation for my stay, the front desk clerk coldly stated she didn't have my record, then claimed I was a no-show (and charged my cc for a night) for an alleged arrival 2 nights prior. Rather than apologize and try to set things straight, she took a confrontational pose and made me feel that I made a mistake. Long story short: she found me a room (same category I booked), but I never felt welcome my 2 nights there. I had a friend with me who witnessed this exchange, and she was shocked by how it was handled.
Despite this sour start, I did like my room and found the public spaces stunning and well worth a visit. The courtyard patio is a lovely escape. My husband and I noted and enjoyed the special touches like generous candy and room amenities, internet access, the chalk board by the elevators that provided the weather report, the news rack by the elevator, nicely appointed gym, and beautiful plantings. We also liked the range of room choices since many NYC hotels have limited choices for those who prefer larger rooms. The hotel is worth visiting just to see a space that is a new build, but totally of another era.
Back to the bad check-in: I'd say it points to poor front desk training and mastery of customer service. Check-in is what sets the first impression of a hotel! Based on this exchange, I had fear that I'd have a problem (even with my email confirmation of my stay) getting my credit card refunded for the "no-show" stay. Thankfully, the reservation manager had it all taken care of the next morning without incident. We've stayed at the Mercer (a sister property) and found the staff professional and personable, which is not what I'd say about the Greenwich (except for the spa desk attendant and the charming housekeeper), where most of the staff had an air of exasperation and disgust.

title: “Loved it”
text: This hotel is really unique. The bed was soo comfortable Everyone that works there is helpful, friendly and really polite. The Spa was really, really nice too. I got myself a few massages and facial treatment and I came out looking like a new person. So relaxing! Also, the pool area was amazing. I would stay here every time I visit New York from now on. I can't wait!

title: “HEAVENLY PERFECTION!!”
text: A friend had suggested The Greenwich Hotel as a place to stay while we were in NYC celeberating my husband's 60th. Being frequent visitors to the city over the last 20 years and having numerous hotels we both love - I thought I would take a chance and try it out. WELL - I don't want to stay anywhere else anymore!! From the moment we checked in to the moment we left 3 days later there was never one misstep. Even prior to our arrival I had numerous email communications with the General Manager to help me arrange dinner reservations and theatre tickets. Again - perfection. The bed and pillows - heaven. The bathroom - again - heaven. The private coutyard and the bar/lounge were wonderful to relax in. A must to experience.

title: “Absolutely perfect!”
text:
The best service, food, and beautiful hotel. The lobby, library and courtyard are very well designed, with a rich color palette and interesting furniture. The courtyard is a dream, open to the sky and landscaped with tall bamboo and garden sculptures.
We stayed in room 514, with French doors overlooking the courtyard. The bed was great-gorgeous sheets. The tile work in our bathroom was breathtaking, very nicely appointed. Lots of storage and quite a spacious layout.
The food at Locanda Verde was excellent, the prices fair. The hotel staff were more than accommodating, and made us feel just as welcome as the celebrities who were also staying at that time. We have stayed at The Standard, and the Gansevoort, and this hotel had larger, superior quality rooms, excellent food, and impeccable service.
Cannot wait to go back!

title: “Tribeca Triumph!!!”
text: Absolutely a wonderful place to stay IF you can afford it...terrific location...nice restaurant attached...great outside area to eat...service was superior...God bless my son for picking up the tab................an absolute, classy place to stay.

title: “Fantastic stay !”
text: My wife and I spent 4 nights here and everything (and I mean everything) was great. The staff was friendly and helpful, the lobby and drawing room are comfortable and inviting and our room/bath was perfect. The designer responsible for the interior did a fantastic job. The furniture, furnishings, flooring materials, art, etc. are an eclectic mix that are unbelievably cool. We have stayed at many of the 4/5 stars in NYC and this will be our new home away from home. I have to say that as a workout fanatic I found the gym to be surprisingly good by hotel standards and never encountered another guest while using it on a daily basis. Even the gym area had gleaming reclaimed wood floors and other unique design touches.

title: “Just fantastic-did not want to go home!!”
text:
We stayed in The Greenwich for 4 nights in March. We had a huge amount of help prior to our trip from the concierge who helped us book cars, restaurant tables etc and gave us great recommendations. 
The hotel is just lovely. Luxurious, homely, understated. The staff are amazing- they could give a masterclass in customer service. Spa gorgeous but no time to make use of it as we were so busy enjoying the best city in the world.
Needless to say we need to go back!

title: “They have thought of everything”
text:
We stayed at the Greenwich for 3 nights at the beginning of May.
They were incredibly helpful before we arrived, managing to secure us a reservation at Per Se and calling beforehand to inform us that Greenwich Street was going to be closed due to the Film Festival so to be dropped off on North Moore and a bellboy would meet us on the corner to help with bags. i then assumed that the hotel was a bit down Greenwich Street but no, it was on the corner and there was no real need for the bellboy to help us, we could have wheeled our luggage the few extra steps.
I lived in NY in 2001 and Tribeca has changed so much since then that we decided to eat locally and after checking out the menu at the restuarant downstairs opted for that. It was fantastic. Great martinis, beautiful simple yet well executed food I couldn't recommend it more.
After trawling the various bars in the near vicinity (there are about 8 bars along North Moore Street between W Broadway and Greenwich) until who knows what time in the morning we came back and collapsed, waking late. We could hear no noise from the street and the room was lovely and dark, we obviously hadn't done this... the turn down service had been, closed the blinds, the nets and the thick curtains as well as closing the window and shutting out the noise of NYC. Bliss.
The bathroom was amazing, enormous rain head shower with lovely products (and lots of them) and sunken bath big enough for two and cotton buds and pads as well as vitamin booster sachets (very handy after the 8 bar crawl...)
The free snacks and soft drinks were fab (again particularly after the bar crawl) and the spa a perfect antidote to the bustle of the city streets, serene, dimly lit, warm and with a fantastic steam room in the changing rooms.
We loved this place, they couldn't have been more helpful, efficient and it seems that in the room they had thought of everything. If I had a pair of ruby slippers i would be clicking them together now saying "there's no place like home" and I would be sent there.

title: “The most delightful stay ever!”
text:
We stayed 3 nights and it was all it took to become my favorite hotel in NYC. 
I absolutely loved this hotel!!! It is so inviting and beautiful. The minute you walk in you feel at home, because of its decor and just the overall comfortable ambiance. 
Beautiful furniture everywhere. Each room has a different decoration, eclectic yet so tasteful! I loved the library. We had brunch on Sunday in front of the fireplace while reading the newspaper. It was windy and cold that day, which made it even more perfect. 
The Pool/Spa area is awesome! Who would have thought a pool in the basement would look so nice! The pictures in the website dont do it justice. 
The restaurant offers so many different options. ALL delicious! You share every plate with the whole table which makes it great to converse and make dinner a fun event! 
I recommend the Ravioli, Lamb Rigatoni and the Pork Chop - DELISH!
Overall, great experience! I will definitely go back many many times! :)

title: “Trendy place, great service”
text:
I was here for business.
I love the location as it's quiet oposite to downtown, where I refuse to stay.
The room are gorgeous and the service at the front desk is amazing. It's extremly rare to have a friendly and luxury servcie in a fashion place.
Restaurant is great, the kind of lounge in the lobby for drink or dinner is extremly comfortable and so cosy. The just breakfast is too expensive.
Spa is fab & the swiming pool is just amazing.

title: “Luxurious and Stylish!”
text:
I was fortunate enough to stay at the Greenwich Hotel during a recent business trip to the Big Apple. The decor was beautiful and truly original, with a rich mixture of cultural motifs contributing to the overall design. The bathrooms were especially gorgeous. What a great place to unwind after a long day of work!
I will definitely be recommending the Greenwich Hotel to co-workers and friends, and it will be my home away from home in NYC from now on!

title: “What a disappointment”
text:
If you are regularly stay at luxury boutique hotels then this one will really disappoint.
If you are easily pleased and just want to go for the cool name factor fine. 
Our first room had a wardrobe that could not be used properly - the door could not be shut and there was a huge scuff and rip on the wallpaper. We asked to be moved though the rug in the second room was dirty. Shabby chic does not equal uncleanliness.
For this price I expect better. The only upside is that the spa is fab - it just a shame that the rest is not. My advice - go elsewhere.

title: “Moorish Zen in this NY-oasis”
text:
I've stayed in a lot of nice/luxurious/design/artyfarty/... hotels in my life, and I must say: The Greenwich Hotels has become a new favourite.
Very stylish. Very relaxing. No cold NY-design. Gorgeous spa. 
The NY-answer to Hazienda Benazuza in Sevilla.
My general advice: don't go there: keep the place exclusive... :-)

title: “Greenwich Hotel, Nirvana in NYC”
text:
My wife's birthday was soon approaching and I was looking for something special and unforgettable that we could enjoy. I did some research and found that the Greenwich hotel style was attractive and the spa looked right up my wife's alley. So I booked a one bedroom corner fireplace suite for a Friday night getaway.
We arrived by car service from Long Island, and I must admit the hotel entrance is difficult to locate, but privacy is a perk of this location. Once in the lobby you are enveloped in a sensory tease of what is to come. Aroma hinting of peony's, colors and textures that warm your heart. 
We were welcomed by Hallelujah who was staffing the front desk. He asked for my name and then asked me if I was ready. I asked ready for what, he said we were upgraded, REALLY upgraded. He then lead us for a quick tour of the lobby and drawing room and to the elevators for a lift to the 6th floor. 
We were rewarded with an upgrade to the most unbelievable suite I have ever laid my eyes on, the Greenwich Suite, a two bedroom, two floored masterpiece with 30 foot windows and fireplace. We were speechless and on the verge of giddy as Hallelujah lead us on the grand tour. He explained the lighting system ( yes, all the lighting is networked) and the fact that we had entrances on both the 6th and 7th floors. Once the formal tour was over he left us to marvel at this suite. Every place your eyes stopped was an ocular delight. The old growth wood floors, the gray aged ceiling joists and panels, the majestic wall of windows overlooking the city, awesome. The dining table was reclaimed wood, and felt inviting to the touch. Placed on the table was fresh fruit, grapes, pears, apples and pomegranate that looked like it was in a still life portrait, my wife had to check to see if they were real. Propped on the fruit was a hand written note from the General Manager welcoming us to the Greenwich. 
There was a full kitchen ( like someone would cook here) and a fully stocked fridge that was gratis. There was a selection of beer, wine and liquor on hand along with a full ice maker. 
The bedroom was inviting, and warm. Doors opened to overlook the courtyard, which must be incredible in the late spring or early fall. The beds were by Duxiana. I have heard the commercials for Dux beds on Newsradio 880 for years and have always wanted to try them. Unfortunately, they were not for us. A little too firm for my tastes. 
The bathrooms were a marble paradise with a huge soaking tub and a walk in shower with a rain shower head. The robes were soft and towels plentiful. The toiletries were by Red Flower and were full sized (nice touch) and smelled incredible. You have to love the energy drink powder, yumm...zoom!
After an evening out on the town, we retired to bed and in the A.M. ordered room service breakfast. The sausage was yummy and the eggs were good enough to comment about, the were organic from an upstate farm. 
We had appointments at the spa, Shibui for 11 A.M. two 50 minute relaxation Swedish treatments. We were greeted by our therapists who proceeded kneed, rub and stretch us to a slumbery bliss. Let me take a minute to talk about the spa and pool. Wow, unbelievable. It was very warm in the pool area, with plenty of seating and lounge chairs. The spa locker rooms had steam showers that you did not want to leave. 
After the spa, our overnight was coming to a close. We stopped by the drawing room for coffee and were surprised to see that Mel Gibson chose to do the same at the table next to us. A cool way to close out a very cool overnight!

title: “A very nice change from the other hotels in the city...”
text:
My girl and I have a tradition that we've started, which is to take a Friday night once every month or every other month and stay in a hotel in the city. Even though we both live here in our own nice apartments, it's nice to stay in a new place and have a romantic night in. The Greenwich Hotel was the place we picked for November 2009.
So far we've stayed at the Standard Hotel twice and the Gramercy Park Hotel once, and both have been fantastic experiences. This time we opted for something different, and thanks to Tablethotels.com, where I am a Tablet Plus member, we found this charming hotel. I had been to the restaurant, Locanda Verde, before, but I had never been inside the hotel. I'm glad we checked in.
i called the day of check-in to confirm my reservation and was told that we were upgraded to a one-bedroom suite from the Greenwich Deluxe room whicih we had originally booked for $695. When I arrived, I found out that the upgrade was no longer available because they had run out of room. I explained this to the desk clerk and how I had been told I was already upgraded and that they had not mentioned that it was "subject to availability." Well, instead of telling me that I was wrong, the desk clerk did some creative thinking and gave me the double upgrade to the corner suite, which was amazing.
The entire decor of the hotel is very European and reminds me of my time in London at the Mandarin Oriental. The bathroom is huge and marbled, and there are some very cool things like glass doors that swing open for the shower and the toilet, which are located in little compartments side by side. There is a large sunken tub that is wonderful for romantic evenings in, as well. And the bathroom amenities were full-size, like the SLS in Beverly Hills, where I stayed a few months ago for business.
The bed was very comfortable, and this room had a nice corner view of Greenwich and N. Moore. The room was decorated as if you had lived there for a decade, and everything was tasteful and of high quality. The old has an old, homey feel, and it doesn't feel like a hotel, which we both loved.
All of the munchies at the minibar were free, as were the non-alcoholic drinks--a very nice change. At check-in, we were given a nice bottle of cabernet and two fresh-baked cookies, along with two letters welcoming us (actually, a letter and a card), and a $50 spa voucher. (Some of these were benefits from being a Tablet Plus member.)
Even though our room was on the fourth floor, it was nice and quiet, and we had a romantic evening and then slept soundly the next morning.
Because of the Tablet Plus status, we actually had a guaranteed 4 p.m. late checkout, but we ended up checking out by 2 p.m. Sad, too--I would have loved to have stayed. There was a pool (rare in Manhattan), but we didn't have a chance to use it.
One more thing...we had dinner downstairs at Locanda Verde. The food is superb, and it has the feel of a neighborhood joint combined with something hipper. The food is amazing--try the ricotta cheese appetizer, the blue crab crostini, the pumpkin agnolotti, the mama's ravioli, and the lamb meatball sliders.

title: “Unique NYC hotel”
text: This is a fantastic hotel if you'd like to try something different to the classic NYC Manhattan hotel experience but still enjoy your 5* luxury. We were on a trip for my birthday and stayed in a Corner Suite which was much better than it looks in the pictures and not noisey at all (fourth floor). The room was very beautiful with a dining table, wet bar and sofas and had the feel of an Italian Villa more than a hotel room in NYC. Everything has already been said about the massive bathroom, luxury full size organic toiletries, wonderful ambiance of public rooms and great food in the restaurant. We found the staff very friendly and polite and even got a personal letter from the General Manager sent to our home thanking us for our comments on our experience at the hotel. If you do any research at all into the background of the building of this hotel and Robert De Niro's personal input into the decor and fittings you will appreciate the effort that has gone into all aspects of this unique hotel. We had a wonderful time and will definately be back. Highly recommended!

title: “Better Places to Spend This Kind of Money”
text:
Service is good, location excellent, vibe is mellow.
Noise from the hallway is unacceptably loud (you can hear an entire conversation at ordinary levels through a closed door, which is all of about 10 feet from your bed, meaning it wakes you up). Also, the shades are sheer, so you can read in your room by 630am, with the lights off. Even if/when they fix these issues, it's a lot of money for not all that much - ordinary-sized room, ok furnishings, fine bathrooms, definitely not a place to remember and return to.

title: “Very good, but with reservations”
text:
Stayed here to try it out as previously stayed at Soho House (fav), Mercer (2nd fav) and The Bowery (least fav of the three).
My wife and I love design hotels, and The Greenwich lived up to expectations in terms of decor in most cases - in general really well done and good atmosphere all round. Borderline 'Swiss chalet' in some areas, but overall a good, warm design. We stayed in a deluxe Greenwich, and a few weird fittings in the room didn't seem to go very well (chandelier for one), but this was offset by the size, bathrooms and overall feel.
Staff were friendly and helpful in many cases - but there's certainly room for improvement - at the front desk in particular - and the speed of service in the communal areas could certainly be improved.
The spa is as good as it looks in the pictures, although the spa treatments seemed totally over the top price-wise - even for a hotel at this level. It's about double of similar places so I gave it a miss although I would have liked to try.
The Italian restaurant (which also served breakfast) was also good - although the breakfast itself was very lacking in terms of any kind of self service items (juice, cereals etc). By lacking i mean non-existent, with menu ordering only.
The courtyard's lovely.
There were a few negatives, and they would make me think twice about staying again.
Noise: The room was very noisy - we could hear another room like the occupants were in ours. May have been through the air vents or something. Unfortunately for us, the guests in that room were [--] all through the night and were [--] movie loud.
Several attempts to address this at front desk and get moved were pretty much dismissed and ignored. They said they were full, but to pay this money and not get any sleep is ridiculous - am sure they had higher spec rooms and should have moved us. Not good.
Perhaps that wouldn't have been quite so bad if the garbage truck didn't stop by outside our room at about 4:30-5am every morning for an hour, crushing rubbish. We had a room on the North Moore side, 4th floor, and I was woken up every morning - after an already reduced sleep. Not good again.
The best part of the room was the free basket of snacks and all soft drinks and water being free - not only that but they're topped up each day! A very nice touch.
Having checked my bill, it looks like they charged the posting of a letter I gave them at checkout to my credit card - £0.64p. Nothing technically wrong with that - but seems a bit petty and has never happened anywhere I've stayed before.
I've never stayed Tribeca before, and thought it was a nice change from Soho and Meatpacking, although in general we always walked into Soho as there's not too much to do around the area (although there is a great breakfast at Bubby's just round the corner)
All-in-all a good experience, but certainly wasn't made to feel special which is always what the end judgement comes down to. Why do these hotels insist on not having the front of house sorted out, and a bit more willing to please? Simple things like that are always the easiest to fix, and make the biggest difference to a guest.

title: “Noisy, noisy, noisy”
text: Stayed here on a business trip. Am used to city sounds but the noises from the restaurants were awful. Kept us up all night. Though the courtyard is beautiful, why ruin the scene with a lat nigh restaurant where most of the dinners are not even staying in the hotel.

title: “Expensive! But amazing service... wram and wonderful.”
text:
Stayed here out of necessity (our hotel booking through a web service at another hotel was not honoured, and all else was booked), and paid well above what we planned, but...
It was beautiful, the staff were attentive, professional, yet casual and friendly. The room was comfortable, stylish, large, warm. "Free" treats, great toiletries, fab bathroom/shower.
And a spa in the basement!
Restaurants were A-1.
A great stay.

title: “Tasteful but pricey”
text:
The Greenwich Hotel is probably the most tastefully decorated hotel I have ever stayed in and I have stayed at over 100 hotels in the last 5 years. However, it also the second most expensive...
I stayed at the Greenwich despite the hotel being out of my price range because it was the only available hotel on Manhattan during Labour weekend 2009. The hotel has a very pleasant lobby and bar, a cosy courtyard and a well equipped gym and spa, which I unfortunately just had a brief look at. It is located in a residential and quiet part of Greenwich, but there is no shortage of restaurants and cafes nearby.
My room had lovely wooden floors, a very comfortable bed, electric curtains, excellent sound proofing, excellent AC system and a beautiful bathroom. Add to free non alcoholic drinks and snacks and I felt right at home.
My only complaint would be the free wifi, which was much too slow and hampered my work. Dont stay here if you need fast internet. For a romantic getaway, this hotel is perfect.

title: “Quite simply the best place in NYC”
text:
My girlfriend and I stayed at the Greenwich Hotel for 3 nights and we did not want to leave. I wish we had booked a longer stay. We found our room to be extremely comfortable, peaceful and quiet. The windows kept out street noise and the heating/cooling system operated perfectly and with absolutely no noise. The public areas, such as the drawing room and the courtyard are awesome. They are comfortable and inviting while at the same time providing an elegance wherein you appreciate you're enjoying something special. We enjoyed glasses of wine in the drawing room and some wonderful meals in the courtyard. Often we had these rooms to ourselves. We also enjoyed the beautifully designed and very peaceful pool area. Every time we used the pool we were the only ones there.
I have already encouraged many friends to try this hotel and it's restaurant, Locanda Verde. The food at Locanda Verde is fantastic. If you're looking for a romantic and/or relaxing place to get away, I couldn't encourage you more strongly to try this hotel. The staff is generally young, very nice and accomodating.
We also enjoyed staying in TriBeCa. It's clean, safe and a bit slower paced. It's easy to get everywhere else in the city, including shopping in SoHo. It has some of the best restaurants all within an easy walk along beautiful city streets. 
We'll be back soon.

title: “A wonderful, magical place!”
text: My wife and I stayed at The Greenwich last week, we needed a local vacation during some repair work on our apartment. Our stay was amazing, the staff is way above par, the cleanliness and atmosphere also were outstanding. We picked the hotel because we loved the interiors we had seen before. The rooms are super comfy, the bed was like home. You also have to see and enjoy the pool, a true wonder in NYC, not to mention the amazing music and atmosphere in the lobby lounge area, we enjoyed a few drinks there and will be back! Overall, it was a great, quiet and relaxing place to stay.

title: “Greenwich Hotel: Best In New York!”
text: Just returned from two nights at the Greenwich Hotel wich is located in TriBeca. The place, opened last year by Rober De Niro, is positively the best place to stay in the city. Casual yet elegant with a young, very friendly staff that excelled at making my wife and I feel welcome. We had been delayed by the airline and had a 7:00 pm play to catch (the reason for the trip) and the staff helped rush us to our room after a quick check-in and had a cab waiting on us to quickly move us uptown to make the play just in time. The room featured a king bed with french doors that overlooked a pretty courtyard and was kitted out with very unusual items and a complimentary mini-bar. A large basket of snacks, ranging from chips to more exotic treats, was in a large wire basket, again no charge. The common rooms feature cool, very comfortable chairs and couches and a wood-burning fireplace adjacent to the open courtyard. The area was quiet, but there were many great restaurants within walking distance. The hotel restaurant had only recently changed hands and the Italian food was over the top. We dined there 2 nights in a row, something unheard of in a city with so many choices. Wake up call at 6 am the day of departure included the typical phone call, but also a knock on our door with a pot of hot coffee. Truly a wonderful over-all experience.

title: “Excellent hotel - we'll get back”
text: Our first stay at this hotel - 4 nigths. Extremely friendly staff. The restaurant Laconda Verde is absolutely recommendable, lots of guests, good service and excellent food. Gym is really OK - we didn't try the Spa but it looks great. Complimentary Internet and non-alcoholic bar (plenty). The hotel is a bit pricy but value-for-money is top. Our room was beautiful (stayed at Superior Greenwich Room). We go to NYC once a year and this will also be our hotel next time. Johansen from Denmark.

title: “Loved it..”
text:
Stayed three nights at The Greenwich Hotel and as the title suggests, we loved it. It's obviously a matter of personal taste, but we love the way they have decorated the hotel and the calm atmosphere that pervades. We stayed in a Deluxe Greenwich room which was lovely and very spacious by New York standards. We also took a look at a Corner Suite, which was beautiful and bigger than some friend's flats... and very expensive. Back in December '08 we stayed at the Gramercy Park Hotel for a few nights and the visit before that we were at the Mercer. The Greenwich is our clear favorite, the other two were good, but the staff at the Gramercy were a little too cool for school and the Mercer is excellent, but feels a little cramped. 
If we weren't so addicted to trying new hotels, this would be the one to make us stick and not twist.

title: “A sophisticated escape”
text: My husband and I chose this new hotel for a much-needed one-night getaway. The first room they brought us to smelled like smoke, which I noticed and mentioned immediately. The staff were gracious and admitted the problem (saying they "can't police their guests" and moved us to a nicer room even though they were "fully committed." The room was spacious with a king size bed, desk, armchair, a settee and other table. The bathroom was done in a unique spanish tile, and was very large with a dual-head shower. The bed was outrageously comfortable. We enjoyed the included (won't call them free for this price) snacks and bevs. We had massages at the spa which were excellent and given by the top guy there. The pool is warm and lovely. Our only complaints were an intermittent high-pitched whining sound, perhaps the elevator, and the fact that our breakfast did not arrive at the requested time and required two phone calls to resolve. Oh--and the wifi requires a password which they do not include in their printed guide--why not? All in all, a good stay and I wish we could afford to stay longer!

title: “Charming hotel”
text: I am a Tribeca resident, and I needed extra space for the Christmas holiday for my family so I selected The Greenwich Hotel. I was very pleased! The hotel exemplifies understated elegance. From the moment you walk into the hotel it feels as if you've escaped from the hectic city. The rooms are a bit pricey, but I felt it was certainly worth it. Each room is individually decorated....a bit eclectic and minimalist, but everything in the room is high quality. The mattresses are Duxiana, and the toiletries were generous portions of Red Flower products (one of my favorites). There was even a wonderful complimentary snack basket in the room with treats such as Twizzlers, Tates Cookies, mints, etc. The public sitting area is beautiful and the restaurant Ago is a great meeting spot. Overall I think it is a great find and a nice change from the more traditional luxury hotels in NYC.

title: “Highly recommended”
text: I stayed in this Tribeca hotel for five nights and will return. My room was lovely with hardwood floors, high ceiling and a large opening window. The amenities were great; the bed comfortable and firm without being rock hard. The staff were excellent; the doormen prompt and friendly, the desk staff attentive and helpful. It has the most beautiful gym I have ever used in my life and the equipment is excellent. Although the website doesn't say (nor do the staff when you call): there is a Japanese style pool as well (about 85F), so be sure to bring a bathing suit. It is quiet with surprisingly little street noise (much less than at the Ganzevoort or the Library Hotels), and the interior door helps keep noise out from the hallways (although they are very quiet in any event). The location is great. It took only a few minutes to walk to Soho, and it is just a couple of blocks off the Hudson River. The riverfront park directly west of the hotel is being restored and is completely torn up right now; however, if you go just a block or two south it is a lovely walk for miles. I felt very safe walking Greenwich Street at night and it was nice to know that the staff would have noticed if I hadn't made it back in the evening. There is a courtyard and lounge for guests only and they are a very nice respite from the city streets without having to hole up in your hotel room. One thing I found annoying were the numerous business meetings the hotel conducted in the lounge. Whenever a meeting was ongoing (every evening), it felt more like I was sitting in a conference room than relaxing in a guest-only lounge. The restaurant was nothing to write home about. The service and ambience were great, but the menu was uninspired and the execution unimpressive. My meal tasted exclusively of salt. Thalassa (a Greek restaurant just a few blocks away) is a much better choice.

title: “Very nice”
text: I recently stayed for 2 nights and was very happy with all aspects of the hotel. The room was eclectic and interesting, like all of the decor in the hotel, and had great sheets, towels, products (Red Flower), etc. I like the gratis mini-bar and snacks (not including alcohol) and free wi-fi. Good pool. Best of all was the service which was so pleasant and helpful. I'd stay there again in a second.

title: “Dissapointing”
text: We stayed at the Greenwich hotel for two nights in October and were overall very dissapointed. The room was big and the bed very confortable, but it was very cold and impersonal. The desk staff were nice, but we felt like we were the only ones staying at the hotel. There were also VERY annoying sounds all night long. There was something depressing about the place. We much preferred the Mercer...

title: “Truly badly conceived and executed.”
text:
I am still surprised that I spent 766.00 per night in such an uninspiring hotel and such a small room which was not starkly furnished, was just bleak.
Lighting is such a problem they put it as a specific multiple choice on the comment card.
The pool was closed for "cleaning' during my stay.
The staff is very good, but that can't make up for the really poorly 
executed project which I found artless and almost depressing.
These people do not get it.

title: “Wonderful stay in Tribeca”
text: We spent one night here on a quick getaway and we were very pleased. The hotel feels European and everything was taken care of. THe room was beautifully appointed with a comfortable bed, high count sheets and a tiny balcony that looked over a courtyard. The bathroom was stunning and luxurious. The mini bar was gratis except for the liquor. They have a beautiful pool and large fitness area. Both are surrounded by the construction (the hotel just opened) but accessible to guests. The only disapppointment was the restaurant Ago which was in a lovely lofy space, but the food was barely adequate. Although the complementary continental breakfast was delicious.
